commit_message:
undercloud-setup: Add a timeout to SSH for multinode vxlan setup

This commit addresses a problem of hung CI jobs during the execution of
toci_vxlan_networking_multinode.sh. Specifically, if incorrect
credentials are passed the job can hang indefinitely until the worker is
reaped. To do this a 'timeout' command is prepended to the script with a
default timeout of 60 seconds.

Change-Id: I2093ed1c7c4e33f96872153b66b7fc446b150fab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/03/417103/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: shell: "timeout --preserve-status 60s {{ working_dir }}/toci_vxlan_networking_multinode.sh > {{ working_dir }}/toci_vxlan_networking_multinode.sh.log 2>&1"

commit_message:
add more detail to the ics output files

Put the titles of the cross-project events in the summary of the
calendar event so they show up in the main calendar view.

Add the full descriptions of the cross-project events to the calendar
event description so any extra notes (such as specific dates for
deadlines) or details about the event are visible to calendar users.

Change-Id: I6eebcdd827241f008522065a40b765b2089e2856
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
quote series name in announce script

If the series name is empty, the release notes generating command line
is incorrect. Quote the series name to avoid parsing issues.

See
http://logs.openstack.org/e9/e9a92503a347f39eb42cb3d6c8a03956d28b1c09/release/wsme-announce-release/b7fe204/console.html
for an example of data where the field is empty.

Change-Id: I9ad0b098f0c7044aa384786fc96a5a66bf19ad45
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
update list_weeks tool to build YAML file

Instead of building the RST table, build a YAML input data file to be
used with the new schedule rendering template. The results will have to
be edited by hand, but we at least get the dates and fixed events
included for free.

Change-Id: I3cc38afd80eb41200c7269a3039e87f01156eaab
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/02/416702/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import yaml def mk_entry(name, week, cross_project=None, project_specific=None): d = { 'start': '{:%Y-%m-%d}'.format(week), 'end': '{:%Y-%m-%d}'.format(week + work_week), } if name: d['name'] = name if cross_project: d['x-project'] = cross_project if project_specific: d['project-specific'] = project_specific return d def add_cycle(name): return '{}-{}'.format(args.prefix_char, name) 'prefix_char', help='single letter prefix for tags', ) parser.add_argument(cycle = [ # Print the date for the previous release. The event name will # need to be replaced manually with the right name. mk_entry('', previous_release_date, cross_project=['REPLACE-WITH-PREVIOUS-RELEASE-REF']), ] for n, w in enumerate(weeks, 1): name = 'R{:<+d}'.format(n - n_weeks) cross_project = [] if n == n_weeks: cross_project.append(add_cycle('final')) cycle.append(mk_entry(name, w, cross_project=cross_project)) current += week cycle.append(mk_entry('R+1', current)) current += week cycle.append(mk_entry('R+2', current, cross_project=[add_cycle('trailing')])) data = { 'cycle': cycle, } print('---') print('start-week: {:%Y-%m-%d}'.format(weeks[0])) print('release-week: {:%Y-%m-%d}'.format(next_release_date)) print(yaml.dump(data, default_flow_style=False, explicit_start=False))
deleted_lines: for i in range(2): current += week weeks.append(current) HEADER = ''' +-------------------+---------------------------+-----------------------------+ | Week | Cross-project events | Project-specific events | +============+======+===========================+=============================+ ''' if not args.etherpad: print(HEADER, end='') TABLE_FORMAT = ''' | {:<10} | {:<4} |{:<27}|{:<29}| +------------+------+---------------------------+-----------------------------+ '''.strip() ETHERPAD_FORMAT = '{} ({})' def show_week(week, name): date_range = '{:%b %d}-{:%d}'.format( week, week + work_week, ) if not args.etherpad: print(TABLE_FORMAT.format(date_range, name, '', '')) else: print(ETHERPAD_FORMAT.format(name, date_range)) # Print the date for the previous release show_week(previous_release_date, '') for n, week in enumerate(weeks, 1): show_week(week, 'R{:<+3d}'.format(n - n_weeks))

subject: support schedule data in parsable format

commit_message:
support schedule data in parsable format

This change converts the Ocata schedule to a YAML file and introduces
the templates needed to render it to a table in the restructuredtext
file so it can be published to HTML again. This is a prerequisite for
also generating an ICS file for the schedule.

Change-Id: I905b47b5b98b6d442c197e0291c44746aaf52bbb
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/01/416701/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sphinxcontrib.datatemplates

subject: fix meta-data extraction in announce script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-04 21:15:44.000000000', 'files': ['announce.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/release-tools/commit/a0cc3a990794a86005102ec723773c7f32cd06b9', 'message': 'fix meta-data extraction in announce script

If the meta-data field is present but empty, using cut results in the
field name being returned instead of an empty value. Switch to a sed
expression to remove the field name from the line instead.

See
http://logs.openstack.org/e9/e9a92503a347f39eb42cb3d6c8a03956d28b1c09/release/wsme-announce-release/b7fe204/console.html
for an example of the failure.

Change-Id: Iffe8ff67161c83240a18a51794fd8c3e4bfb2f4d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix meta-data extraction in announce script

If the meta-data field is present but empty, using cut results in the
field name being returned instead of an empty value. Switch to a sed
expression to remove the field name from the line instead.

See
http://logs.openstack.org/e9/e9a92503a347f39eb42cb3d6c8a03956d28b1c09/release/wsme-announce-release/b7fe204/console.html
for an example of the failure.

Change-Id: Iffe8ff67161c83240a18a51794fd8c3e4bfb2f4d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/release-tools refs/changes/35/416735/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "$TAG_META" | grep "^meta:$fieldname:" | sed "s/meta:$fieldname: *//"

commit_message:
Ansible-ize OpenStack Designate

Implement ansible role to deploy designate
and dependencies. The backend used is bind9.

Co-Authored-By: zhubingbing <zhubingbing10@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Eduardo Gonzalez <dabarren@gmail.com>

Depends-On: 6d0dc3e0f931c7c50b64a4659900cc50b0d860a2
Implements: blueprint ansible-designate
Change-Id: I34d8126e0cd8d71d5ced9b62f3776cc354fbb549

added_lines: designate_api_port: "9001" enable_designate: "no"

commit_message:
composite: fix evaluation of trending state alarms

When threshold evaluator returns a trending state instead of a state,
the composite evaluator ignores it and passes the alarm to insufficient
data instead of using it.

This change fixes that.

Closes-bug: #1645344

Change-Id: I4703936e0377a466e09c97b5485191b17442b57d

commit_message:
api-ref: microversion 2.40 overview

Add a brief overview of the microversion 2.40 changes to the simple
tenant usage api-ref.

 - limit
 - marker
 - max_limit
 - stitching results
 - next links

Implements blueprint paginate-simple-tenant-usage

Change-Id: I4421aaca23f0d7f00ae22ec7b0366d5d6791b26d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/44/415744/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Microversion 2.40 added pagination (and ``next`` links) to the usage statistics via optional ``limit`` and ``marker`` query parameters. If ``limit`` isn't provided, the configurable ``max_limit`` will be used which currently defaults to 1000. Older microversions will not accept these new paging query parameters, but they will start to silently limit by ``max_limit``. .. code-block:: none /os-simple-tenant-usage?limit={limit}&marker={instance_uuid} /os-simple-tenant-usage/{tenant_id}?limit={limit}&marker={instance_uuid} .. note:: A tenant's usage statistics may span multiple pages when the number of instances exceeds ``limit``, and API consumers will need to stitch together the aggregate results if they still want totals for all instances in a specific time window, grouped by tenant.

commit_message:
[overcloud-deploy] Fix hosts file generation

- When pacemaker is disabled, we don't have overcloud public vip.
  This patch avoids to append a canonical hostname w/o IP address.

Change-Id: I0041e861adef57465c8df9c820f709b4337c2ee6
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove references to Python 3.4

Now that there exists only a gate job for Python 3.5 and not 3.4,
we should remove those references to the 3.4 that is untested.

Change-Id: I067d84b89167c5e84373cb0656348d3e7a573a45

commit_message:
undercloud-setup: Add 'sudo' to commands in necessary tasks

Some tasks in the undercloud-setup role require being run as root.
Instead of using ansible's 'become' feature we should add 'sudo' into
the commands in each script that require elevated permissions.

Change-Id: I81f83e7df47d5844df2321d60d6bc7ec6b25a3d8

commit_message:
Allow basic install to work on Fedora

These were the only things I needed to do to get a basic
installation going on Fedora 25 using the following command:

  quickstart.sh --no-clone -e supported_distro_check=false 127.0.0.2

One of the primary issues I found was that the installation of
ipxe-roms-qemu via the package module would actually break the
iPXE rom installation because it would revert to an older version
that had incorrect symlinks.

Change-Id: I01f68708f4caeef5f840e7a89637f1a786e1381e

The OVB role was written at first to work with ready undercloud
images. This review changes the workflow to use a vanilla
guest image for the undercloud and set up the users, repos
and overcloud images after the OVB stack is deployed.

This streamlines the OVB workflow on different environments.

commit_message:
Modify OVB role to work with non-ready undercloud images

The OVB role was written at first to work with ready undercloud
images. This review changes the workflow to use a vanilla
guest image for the undercloud and set up the users, repos
and overcloud images after the OVB stack is deployed.

This streamlines the OVB workflow on different environments.

Change-Id: Ic8f40b5e38fab5aee3dc84d6fb1462b3f0f61ca7

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-05 15:33:11.000000000', 'files': ['releasetools/release_notes.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/release-tools/commit/c99f81423d9c066faa452ace331b0daf073ba46d', 'message': 'adjust the emotions in the template

Not all of the adjectives we had in the emotion list are appropriate,
and some produce awkward phrasing when used in the structure "are $word
to". Adjust the emotion list to remove the items that fit poorly and
adjust the template and remaining items to use "We $emotion announce" as

Change-Id: I976fc6cd4305edc8ea04629bd3e4d4e68ad6bbc7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
adjust the emotions in the template

Not all of the adjectives we had in the emotion list are appropriate,
and some produce awkward phrasing when used in the structure "are $word
to". Adjust the emotion list to remove the items that fit poorly and
adjust the template and remaining items to use "We $emotion announce" as
the structure, allowing more variation in the form of emotion being
plugged in.

Change-Id: I976fc6cd4305edc8ea04629bd3e4d4e68ad6bbc7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

admonitions, and document the node management commands introduced in
Newton.

commit_message:
Remove references to Python 3.4

Now that there exists only a gate job for Python 3.5 and not 3.4,
we should remove those references to the 3.4 that is untested.

Change-Id: Ia017d1199f8ca31808680b91c708823711127659

commit_message:
Don't include api/scheduler manifests on manila share service set up

Manila pacemaker manifest (which sets manila share service only)
includes also manila api and scheduler manifests. There is no
reason for this. Also it causes that on whichever node manila share
service runs also manila api and scheduler services are started.

Change-Id: Ia1b39ef36c5bc34813cd6430b69ad9b698acc3cf
Closes-Bug: #1653500

commit_message:
Fix trove role issue

* add the bind_host and bind_port option for trove api service
* add emptry upgrade.yml file

Change-Id: Ie861e43f98d513d2831303249ddf407de40bba2a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/55/412855/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: bind_port = {{ trove_api_port }} bind_host = {{ hostvars[inventory_hostname]['ansible_' + api_interface]['ipv4']['address'] }}

subject: Network problem tolerance puppet status check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-30 11:16:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute/commit/d44cb01273dafba706caa16f285f9cf569b1c472', 'message': 'More status check before fail

Connection between node and Astute can be lost some
times, so we need more tries to get info about task
status on node.

So instead of 1 try Astute will run 6 tries with 10
timeout for every attempt.

Instead of full retry status retry is safety because
it is idempotent.

Change-Id: Ie86576a3400be5a6b11041c8e6acf89abf3bbd51
Related-Bug: #1653210
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-05 15:09:09.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/config.rb', 'lib/astute/mclients/puppet_mclient.rb', 'lib/astute/tasks/puppet.rb', 'lib/astute/puppet_job.rb', 'spec/unit/puppet_job_spec.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute/commit/7c0485eb1a8c75a57936eaecce935091659429e9', 'message': 'Network problem tolerance puppet status check

Connection between node and Astute can be lost some
times, so we need more tries to get info about task
status on node.

Two changes:

- instead of 1 try Astute will run 6 tries with 10
timeout for every attempt;
- it will process such behavior for puppet using separately
  retries: puppet_undefined_retries

Instead of full puppet retry status retry is safety because
it is idempotent.

Puppet undefined retries can be setup using Astute config
or sending undefined_retries in puppet task parameters same
way as for usual retries. Most important thing: it will refresh
to original value every time when Astute get defined answer.

Change-Id: Ie86576a3400be5a6b11041c8e6acf89abf3bbd51
Related-Bug: #1653210
Closes-Bug: #1653737
'}]
commit_message:
Network problem tolerance puppet status check

Connection between node and Astute can be lost some
times, so we need more tries to get info about task
status on node.

Two changes:

- instead of 1 try Astute will run 6 tries with 10
timeout for every attempt;
- it will process such behavior for puppet using separately
  retries: puppet_undefined_retries

Instead of full puppet retry status retry is safety because
it is idempotent.

Puppet undefined retries can be setup using Astute config
or sending undefined_retries in puppet task parameters same
way as for usual retries. Most important thing: it will refresh
to original value every time when Astute get defined answer.

Change-Id: Ie86576a3400be5a6b11041c8e6acf89abf3bbd51
Related-Bug: #1653210
Closes-Bug: #1653737
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute refs/changes/60/415860/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def puppetd(timeout=nil, retries=1) _timeout=timeout, _retries=retries, @summary = puppetd(_timeout=10, _retries=6).last_run_summary(

subject: Add support for module ordering on apply
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-29 06:06:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/ec699c921c726f5008c2bb0bdea9f5cccf4b71ff', 'message': "Add support for module ordering on apply

A method for specifying 'priority' modules plus a way to rank the order
in which modules are applied has been added.  Two new attributes
'priority_apply' and 'apply_order' are available in the payload
on create and update.  In addition, an is_admin flag was added as an
automatic attribute, to be set when someone with admin credentials
creates a module or updates an existing module with 'admin-only'
options.  This allows better control on the driver plugin
side with regards to security concerns, etc.  The attribute is
now passed in to the guest 'apply' interface for use by the driver.
All three of these attributes are stored in the Trove database.

An admin can create a 'non-admin' module by passing in --full_access
on the command line (or python interface).  This will cause an
error if any admin-only options are selected.

Scenario tests have been added to verify that the modules are
applied in the correct order.  The timestamp for the 'updated'
field on the guest was also enhanced to allow for fractional
seconds, since most applies take less than a second.

The issue where modules were allowed to be applied even if
they belonged to a different datastore has been fixed and
scenario tests added to check for this case.

Change-Id: I7fcd0cf12790564ba62e7d6451fff96f763e539d
Depends-On: I2b871c7d1eab634174396bd0905329f3a66755f6
Implements: blueprint module-management-ordering
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-25 18:23:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/ceb4ec76e0012efe7be7e53be7e174f181ac5864', 'message': "Add support for module ordering on apply

applied in the correct order.  The timestamp for the 'updated'
field on the guest was also enhanced to allow for fractional
seconds, since most applies take less than a second.

The issue where modules were allowed to be applied even if
they belonged to a different datastore has been fixed and
scenario tests added to check for this case.

commit_message:
Add support for module ordering on apply

A method for specifying 'priority' modules plus a way to rank the order
in which modules are applied has been added.  Two new attributes
'priority_apply' and 'apply_order' are available in the payload
on create and update.  In addition, an is_admin flag was added as an
automatic attribute, to be set when someone with admin credentials
creates a module or updates an existing module with 'admin-only'
options.  This allows better control on the driver plugin
side with regards to security concerns, etc.  The attribute is
now passed in to the guest 'apply' interface for use by the driver.
All three of these attributes are stored in the Trove database.

An admin can create a 'non-admin' module by passing in --full_access
on the command line (or python interface).  This will cause an
error if any admin-only options are selected.

Scenario tests have been added to verify that the modules are
applied in the correct order.  The timestamp for the 'updated'
field on the guest was also enhanced to allow for fractional
seconds, since most applies take less than a second.

The issue where modules were allowed to be applied even if
they belonged to a different datastore has been fixed and
scenario tests added to check for this case.

Change-Id: I7fcd0cf12790564ba62e7d6451fff96f763e539d
Implements: blueprint module-management-ordering

commit_message:
Serialize max queues count for dpdk interfases

We need to configure queues count on dpdk interfaces.
The count should be limited by max supported queues
value on DPDK NIC and number of CPUs for DPDK usage.

Change-Id: I9b3160b7e0659d11445ca3927aa38e523a93b3a9
Partial-Bug: #1643920
Depends-On: Iffa1a6c872b46230de6e9ab3b8f34cb727661571

added_lines: def get_dpdk_queues_count(cls, instance): dpdk_cpu_pining = instance.node.attributes.get( 'cpu_pinning', {}).get('dpdk', {}).get('value', 0) max_queues = instance.meta.get('interface_properties', {}).get('max_queues', 0) if dpdk_cpu_pining > max_queues: return max_queues return dpdk_cpu_pining @classmethod 'numa_node': interface_properties.get('numa_node'), 'max_queues': interface_properties.get('max_queues')

commit_message:
Add --disable-validations

The validations run by tripleoclient do not need to be run at all when
using split stack (multinode, deployed-server, etc).

While we already have --validation-errors-nonfatal, you still see the
log messages about the failed validations, which can create end user
confusion.

The --disable-validations argument will disable running the validations
completely.

Change-Id: I61d5ead3d8eaf165bba6d277adbe3a1d84d1e5e7
Partially-implements: blueprint split-stack-software-configuration

Ignoring these errors is likely to lead to " "a failed deploy.", errors) if parsed_args.validation_warnings_fatal or \ parsed_args.validation_errors_fatal: return if warnings > 0: self.log.error( "Configuration has %d warnings, fix them before " "proceeding.", warnings) if parsed_args.validation_warnings_fatal: return else: self.log.info("SUCCESS: No warnings or errors in deploy " "configuration, proceeding.")

commit_message:
Support python 3.5 in tox

Our current tox configuration provides no support for python 3.5
even though it is the version that ships with current ubuntu
(xenial) and Fedora (25) systems, and even though in gate the
python3 jobs run on xenial with python 3.5.

Add py35 env to tox.ini alongside py34, py27, and pep8.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ib32069f9185c5233c8f96164781ec66c56db33bd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/45/417245/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py35,py34,py27,pep8[testenv:debug-py35] basepython = python3.5 commands = oslo_debug_helper {posargs}

commit_message:
Remove the usage of MagnumObjectDictCompat from magnum_service

Nova has removed the usage of NovaObjectDictCompat:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/rm-object-dict-compat.
magnum needs a similar cleanup.

Change-Id: I07ce6db76aaca517aadff6fba7fb51ff0972ccca
Partially-Implements: blueprint rm-object-dict-compat

deleted_lines: class MyObj(base.MagnumPersistentObject, base.MagnumObject, base.MagnumObjectDictCompat): class Foo(base.MagnumPersistentObject, base.MagnumObject, base.MagnumObjectDictCompat): def test_get(self): obj = MyObj(self.context, foo=1) # Foo has value, should not get the default self.assertEqual(1, obj.get('foo', 2)) # Foo has value, should return the value without error self.assertEqual(1, obj.get('foo')) # Bar is not loaded, so we should get the default self.assertEqual('not-loaded', obj.get('bar', 'not-loaded')) # Bar without a default should lazy-load self.assertEqual('loaded!', obj.get('bar')) # Bar now has a default, but loaded value should be returned self.assertEqual('loaded!', obj.get('bar', 'not-loaded')) # Invalid attribute should raise AttributeError self.assertRaises(AttributeError, obj.get, 'nothing') # ...even with a default self.assertRaises(AttributeError, obj.get, 'nothing', 3) class TestObj(base.MagnumPersistentObject, base.MagnumObject, base.MagnumObjectDictCompat):

commit_message:
Use dict_merge instead of update

During fetching NIC and Bonds attributes
attributes have been rewritten insted of
extending.

Change-Id: I542b601fc1cc154eccaa6fba1a0442a19b7b3353
Closes-Bug: #1644563
(cherry picked from commit 220f8b4b77fa1c0c38b4dc758acf2389792f54eb)

commit_message:
[ha-guide] use code-block for RabbitMQ installtion

The duplicated text "Install RabbitMQ" that becomes markup label
breaks the build of the translated guide.

Change-Id: Ifb8b2fd37f8b13d84f639e170936e67709283d65
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/36/417336/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: you are using. For Ubuntu or Debian: .. code-block: console # apt-get install rabbitmq-server For RHEL, Fedora, or CentOS: .. code-block: console # yum install rabbitmq-server For openSUSE: .. code-block: console # zypper install rabbitmq-server For SLES 12: .. code-block: console # zypper addrepo -f obs://Cloud:OpenStack:Kilo/SLE_12 Kilo [Verify the fingerprint of the imported GPG key. See below.] # zypper install rabbitmq-server
deleted_lines: you are using: .. list-table:: Install RabbitMQ :widths: 15 30 :header-rows: 1 * - Distribution - Command * - Ubuntu, Debian - :command:`# apt-get install rabbitmq-server` * - RHEL, Fedora, CentOS - :command:`# yum install rabbitmq-server` * - openSUSE - :command:`# zypper install rabbitmq-server` * - SLES 12 - :command:`# zypper addrepo -f obs://Cloud:OpenStack:Kilo/SLE_12 Kilo` [Verify the fingerprint of the imported GPG key. See below.] :command:`# zypper install rabbitmq-server`

'}, {'number': 15, 'created': '2016-02-10 13:11:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/de842e976703cbdd5fc9e6219a1730fac2990df0', 'message': "Remove threading before process forking

Forking procecces when a few threads are already running i potentially
unsafe operation and could cause alot of problems because only current
thread will continue working in child thread. Any locked by other
thread resource will ramain locked forever.

We faced with this problem during oslo.messaging development and
added workaround to hide this problem:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/274255/

I tried to fix this problem in oslo.service:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/270832/

but oslo folks said that this fix is ugly and it is wrong way to add
workarrouns to common libraries because projects use them incorectly.
I think that is fare.

So this patch fixes incorrect usage of oslo libraries. In this patch
I extended Functioanality of NeutronWorker and add there
`worker_process_count` parameter which determines how many processes
should be spawned for this worker. If `worker_process_count` = 0 - dont
create process and spawn thread in scope of current process for worker

Then I moved all background tasks to workers and return them by
`get_workers` method and spawn threaded workers and spawning workrer's
processes

Change-Id: I0544f1d47ae53d572adda872847a56fa0b202d2e

but oslo folks said that this fix is ugly and it is wrong way to add
workarounds to common libraries because projects use them incorrectly.
I think that is fare.

So this patch fixes incorrect usage of oslo libraries. In this patch
I extended functionality of NeutronWorker and add there
`worker_process_count` parameter which determines how many processes
should be spawned for this worker. If `worker_process_count` = 0 - don't
create process and spawn thread in scope of current process for worker

Then I moved all background tasks to workers and return them by
`get_workers` method. start_plugin_workers collects plugin's workers
using `get_workers` method and starts in ProcessLauncher frist workers
with `worker_process_count` > 0 and only after this starts threaded
workers by simple Launcher

Change-Id: I0544f1d47ae53d572adda872847a56fa0b202d2e

`worker_process_count` attribute which determines how many processes
should be spawned for this worker. If `worker_process_count` = 0 - don't
create process and spawn thread in scope of current process for worker

Then I moved all background tasks to workers and return them by
`get_workers` method. start_plugin_workers collects plugin's workers
using `get_workers` method and starts in ProcessLauncher first workers
with `worker_process_count` > 0 and only after this starts threaded
workers by simple Launcher

commit_message:
Remove threading before process forking

Forking a process when multiple threads are running is an unsafe
operation and could cause a lot of problems because only current
thread will continue working in child thread. Any locked by other
thread resource will remain locked forever.

We faced with this problem during oslo.messaging development and
added workaround to hide this problem:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/274255/

I tried to fix this problem in oslo.service:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/270832/

but oslo folks said that this fix is ugly and it is wrong way to add
workarounds to common libraries because projects use them incorrectly.
I think that is fair.

So this patch fixes incorrect usage of oslo libraries. In this patch
I extended functionality of NeutronWorker and add there
`worker_process_count` parameter which determines how many processes
should be spawned for this worker. If `worker_process_count` = 0 - don't
create process and spawn thread in scope of current process for worker

Then I moved all background tasks to workers and return them by
`get_workers` method. start_plugin_workers collects plugin's workers
using `get_workers` method and starts in ProcessLauncher first workers
with `worker_process_count` > 0 and only after this starts threaded
workers by simple Launcher

Closes-bug: #1569404

Change-Id: I0544f1d47ae53d572adda872847a56fa0b202d2e

commit_message:
Fix operation handler invocation in node

We were providing incorrect set of parameters when invoking the
operation handlers from profiles. This patch fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I6d2419407f98ee58fd9e39e3a21201123acf4139

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-30 13:41:06.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/orchestrator/deployment_serializers.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/35798c0c0545097cd491fbdd6f1a69c6846ae51d', 'message': 'Do not lock nodes records for a long time

As a part of cluster serialization primary tags on nodes are updated.
This results in updated nodes record to be locked until the transaction
where serialization happens ends. When there is a lot of nodes this
transaction can be very long and, as a result, a lot of node updates by
nailgun agent can be blocked until it ends. At some points this results
in all workers being busy blocking any REST call.

Change-Id: Ie5341290097bddce299bf5726e2607d150c23768
Closes-Bug: #1643024
(cherry picked from commit acf86ab9e23a2ca59425055397650e892af5f7ad)

commit_message:
Do not lock nodes records for a long time

As a part of cluster serialization primary tags on nodes are updated.
This results in updated nodes record to be locked until the transaction
where serialization happens ends. When there is a lot of nodes this
transaction can be very long and, as a result, a lot of node updates by
nailgun agent can be blocked until it ends. At some points this results
in all workers being busy blocking any REST call.

Change-Id: Ie5341290097bddce299bf5726e2607d150c23768
Closes-Bug: #1643024
(cherry picked from commit acf86ab9e23a2ca59425055397650e892af5f7ad)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/77/415877/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nailgun.db import db # commit the transaction immediately so that the updates # made to nodes don't lock other updates to these nodes # until this, possibly very long, transation ends. db().commit()

commit_message:
Do not lock nodes records for a long time

As a part of cluster serialization primary tags on nodes are updated.
This results in updated nodes record to be locked until the transaction
where serialization happens ends. When there is a lot of nodes this
transaction can be very long and, as a result, a lot of node updates by
nailgun agent can be blocked until it ends. At some points this results
in all workers being busy blocking any REST call.

Change-Id: Ie5341290097bddce299bf5726e2607d150c23768
Closes-Bug: #1643024
(cherry picked from commit acf86ab9e23a2ca59425055397650e892af5f7ad)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/82/415882/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nailgun.db import db # commit the transaction immediately so that the updates # made to nodes don't lock other updates to these nodes # until this, possibly very long, transation ends. db().commit()

commit_message:
Revise history.rst format for rendering

This fixes the format of the ReST file so that it renders in a better
manner.

Change-Id: I80782d927f980f7e2715cda1a179896a103a98e6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/73/417273/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - This is the initial version of the v1 API which supports microversions. - Added ``cluster_collect`` API. This API takes a single parameter ``path`` and interprets it as a JSON path for extracting node properties. Properties values from all nodes are aggregated into a list and returned to users. - Added ``profile_validate`` API. This API is provided to validate the spec of a profile without really creating a profile object. - Added ``policy_validate`` API. This API validates the spec of a policy without creating a policy object. - Added ``cluster_replace_nodes`` API. This API enables users to replace the specified existing nodes with ones that were not members of any clusters. - Added ``profile_type_ops`` API. This API returns a dictionary containing the operations and parameters supported by a specific profile type. - Added ``node_operation`` API. This API enables users to trigger an operation on a node. The operation and its parameters are determined by the profile type. - Added ``cluster_operation`` API. This API enables users to trigger an operation on a cluster. The operation and its parameters are determined by the profile type. - Added ``user`` query parameter for listing receivers.
deleted_lines: This is the initial version of the v1 API which supports microversions. Added ``cluster_collect`` API. Added ``profile_validate`` API. Added ``policy_validate`` API. Added ``cluster_replace_nodes`` API. Added ``profile_type_ops`` API. Added ``cluster_operation`` API. Added ``node_operation`` API. Added 'user' query parameter for listing receivers.

commit_message:
Unit test for ClusterAction.do_update

This patch adds unit test for ClusterAction.do_update.

Change-Id: Ieb5bd985f13117f9eb9367975d12ff9f505864a0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/07/417007/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: action.inputs = {'name': 'FAKE_NAME', 'metadata': {'foo': 'bar'}, 'timeout': 3600, 'new_profile_id': 'FAKE_PROFILE'} def test_do_update_set_status_failed(self, mock_update, mock_load): node1 = mock.Mock(id='fake id 1') node2 = mock.Mock(id='fake id 2') cluster = mock.Mock(id='FAKE_ID', nodes=[node1, node2], ACTIVE='ACTIVE') mock_load.return_value = cluster action = ca.ClusterAction(cluster.id, 'CLUSTER_ACTION', self.ctx) cluster.do_update.return_value = False reason = 'Cluster update failed.' # do it res_code, res_msg = action.do_update() # assertions self.assertEqual(action.RES_ERROR, res_code) self.assertEqual(reason, res_msg) self.assertEqual(0, mock_update.call_count) @mock.patch.object(ca.ClusterAction, '_update_nodes')

commit_message:
Fix variable name

The test was using the wrong variable for the TokenClient (token),
it has been merged since the patch who enables the feature was still
under review in DevStack. This patch fixes the issue by using the
correct variable name (non_admin_token).

Change-Id: Id97ca26f93b742cc3d8d49e98afc581f22360504

subject: Modify variable's using method in Log Messages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-04 07:13:00.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/functional/api/v1/clients/bay_client.py', 'magnum/tests/functional/api/v1/clients/cluster_client.py', 'magnum/tests/functional/python_client_base.py', 'magnum/common/keystone.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/2ee054c1f5f5cd48f007b51c600133cbad376da5', 'message': "Modify variable's using method in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code,
rather than being done at the point of the logging call.
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation
For example:
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: Ifaf1dfe589615732e412c4e640cf46679abc9023
Closes-Bug: #1643463
"}]
commit_message:
Modify variable's using method in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code,
rather than being done at the point of the logging call.
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation
For example:
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: Ifaf1dfe589615732e412c4e640cf46679abc9023
Closes-Bug: #1643463
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/55/416455/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/59/409159/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(Support for manual/auto_commit functionality) # When auto_commit is False, consumer can manually notify # the completion of the subscription. # Currently we don't support for non auto commit option
deleted_lines: # TODO(Support for manual/auto_commit functionality) # When auto_commit is False, consumer can manually notify # the completion of the subscription. # Currently we don't support for non auto commit option self.auto_commit = True def commit(self): """Commit is used by subscribers belonging to the same group. After subscribing messages, commit is called to prevent the other subscribers which belong to the same group from re-subscribing the same messages. Currently self.auto_commit option is always True, so we don't need to call this function. """ self.consumer.commit() def commit(self): # TODO(Support for manually/auto commit functionality) # It's better to allow users to commit manually and support for # self.auto_commit = False option. For now, this commit function # is meaningless since user couldn't call this function and # auto_commit option is always True. self.conn.commit()

commit_message:
Do not replace failed server always

Overrides needs_replace_failed() to decide whether to replace
the server resource if it's in *_FAILED (except CHECK_FAILED).

Blueprint: custom-update-replace-for-failed-resources
Change-Id: I3e389fb7fb0762cbdada1e4c1da4cc8eac5e7214

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-28 15:20:58.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/odl-releases/common'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl/commit/0c9f1de0111cdc2e71be2e5ab26fef019281f198', 'message': 'Fix syntax in devstack/odl-releases/common

When devstack/plugin.sh imports ODL settings and if ODL_RELEASE variable

Change-Id: I4cdb7e84e8e6c65113c0765ce0439abbb0e18504
'}]
commit_message:
Fix syntax in devstack/odl-releases/common

When devstack/plugin.sh imports ODL settings and if ODL_RELEASE variable
doesn't include "-snapshot-", it ends in error because of the wrong
awk syntax in devstack/odl-releases/common.
Fix the awk syntax.

Change-Id: I4cdb7e84e8e6c65113c0765ce0439abbb0e18504
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/87/415487/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _name=$(echo ${_odl_release} | awk -F- '{print toupper(substr($1, 1, 1))substr($1, 2)}') _version=$(echo ${_odl_release} | awk -F- '{print $2}') _sr=$(echo ${_odl_release} | awk -F- '{print $3}')

commit_message:
kafka: return to poller when timeout is reach

consume() must return only if user timeout is reached and not
when driver consumer_timeout is reached.

Change-Id: I6b2b2a28038a194224e79fa37285436ca6787a0a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/58/409158/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _raise_timeout(exc): raise driver_common.Timeout(exc.message) timer = driver_common.DecayingTimer(duration=timeout) timer.start() poll_timeout = (self.consumer_timeout if timeout is None else min(timeout, self.consumer_timeout)) while True: if self._consume_loop_stopped: return try: return self._poll_messages(poll_timeout) except kafka.errors.ConsumerTimeout as exc: poll_timeout = timer.check_return( _raise_timeout, exc, maximum=self.consumer_timeout) except Exception: LOG.exception(_LE("Failed to consume messages")) return
deleted_lines: if self._consume_loop_stopped: return None timeout = timeout if timeout >= 0 else self.consumer_timeout try: messages = self._poll_messages(timeout) except kafka.errors.ConsumerTimeout as e: raise driver_common.Timeout(e.message) except Exception: LOG.exception(_LE("Failed to consume messages")) messages = None return messages

commit_message:
Fix the misleading setup.py nosetests

Now execute `PYTHONPATH='../horizon/'
DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE=muranodashboard.tests.settings python setup.py nosetests`
will gives some error, this is misleading, This patch add a config to let
it works normal.

Change-Id: I99c6f4b062656973c8e8a88cbddd0247ebc5a8a1
Closes-Bug: #1618905
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard refs/changes/02/417302/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: collect-only = 1

commit_message:
WIP: Enable Swift ring building action

A temporary Swift URL is created before starting the deployment itself
and will be used to fetch the rings from the undercloud. The Mistral
action to build the rings will be started in parallel and running in the
background, waiting until nodes are started before.

This patch doesn't change the current Swift ring building process yet.
A second patch for tripleo-heat-templates will fetch the newly build
rings and disable Puppet ring building [1].

[1] Related patch: I551151d92eefd5e4391a610b22e47c2833ef0564

Closes-Bug: 1609421
Change-Id: Id0659a60958c467b061ba88f3ddd69ed731210ac

added_lines: 'get_orchestration_client') @mock.patch('tripleo_common.actions.base.TripleOAction.' mock_get_workflow_client, mock_get_orchestration_client): # Pretend Heat created the stack, no need to wait mock_heat = mock.MagicMock() mock_resource = mock.MagicMock() mock_resource.updated_time = "2063-01-01T12:00:00Z" mock_resource.resource_status = "CREATE_COMPLETE" mock_heat.resources.get.return_value = mock_resource mock_get_orchestration_client.return_value = mock_heat

subject: Add Swift ring building action for Mistral
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-04 21:58:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/b40c82f997e725bb695e5442d7702df103ea4362', 'message': 'WIP: Add Swift ring building action for Mistral

This patch adds a new action for Mistral to create and update Swift rings
on the undercloud node for deployment on the overcloud nodes.

Workflow:
1. Gather disk info from the introspection data
2. Create or update rings based on these informations and prepare a
   .tar.gz file to be used as a deployment artifact.
3. Upload the .tar.gz with the rings to the undercloud Swift deployment.
4. Update the following parameter_defaults: DeployArtifactURLs, NodeDataLookup

This patch is still a work in progress; submitted for early feedback.

To do:
- enable t-h-t/puppet/extraconfig/pre_deploy/per_node.yaml by default
- use loppback devices if not enough disks found
- only include disks from nodes that will be deployed
- fetch existing .builder files beforehand
- remove devices that are no longer available and having a weight of 0
- set weight of non-existing disks to 0 if not yet removed
- smooth transition for added, removed or changed disks
- upgrade from legacy pre-Ocata rings ("d1" rings)
- documentation

See http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tripleo-common/readme.html how
to install this new action for testing. Do not forget to update the
workbook using the following command:

 mistral workbook-update workbooks/deployment.yaml

Related-Bug: 1609421

This patch adds a new Mistral action to create and update Swift rings.

Swift rings are now built on the undercloud, and pushed to the overcloud
nodes using DeployArtifactURLs. Introspection data is used to find disks
usable for Swift, and these are added to the rings. At the same time
hieradata entries are created for these disks to partition them.

The created Swift rings are kept on the undercloud (in the artifacts
container), and updates to the rings will re-use them to keep a
continuos history and smooth transitions in case of changes. This makes
it possible to replace or add new nodes to an existing cluster without
manual operator interaction.

Instead of using a single "d1" directory on the controller nodes to for
Swift, OOO will now use multiple available disks for storage. Loopback
devices on the controller nodes will be used if not enough disks are
available.

This patch also disables ring building using puppet-swift on the
overcloud nodes, and enables the Swift mount check option in Swift.

See [1] how to install this new action for testing. Do not forget to
update the workbook using the following command:

 mistral workbook-update workbooks/deployment.yaml

You also need to register t-h-t/puppet/extraconfig/pre_deploy/per_node.yaml
to be able to use the node-specific hieradata (see [2]).

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tripleo-common/readme.html
[2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tripleo-docs/advanced_deployment/node_specific_hieradata.html

Closes-Bug: 1609421

commit_message:
Add Swift ring building action for Mistral

This patch adds a new Mistral action to create and update Swift rings.

The basic idea is to build the Swift rings on the undercloud, and these
rings will be fetched by the overcloud nodes during deployment.

The action needs to be executed once nodes are running, but before the
Puppet deployment starts. Introspection data is then used to find disks
usable for Swift, and these are added to the rings. At the same time
hieradata entries are created for these disks to partition them.

This patch doesn't change the current Swift ring building process yet.

The created Swift rings are kept on the undercloud, and updates to the
rings will re-use them to keep a continuos history and smooth
transitions in case of changes. This makes it possible to add, remove or
replace nodes in an existing cluster without manual operator
interaction.

Instead of using a single "d1" directory on the controller nodes to for
Swift, this will use multiple available disks for storage. Loopback
devices on the controller nodes will be used if not enough disks are
available.

Related-Bug: 1609421
Change-Id: Ie3dd3ea5658c56392701e5868ffc4f83576dbb5b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/33/406633/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tripleo.swiftrings.prepare_rings = tripleo_common.actions.swiftrings:SwiftPrepareRingsAction

subject: Fetch and deploy Swift rings built on the undercloud
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-02 16:11:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/c0f483f0b304b6c2516624a9693fe66944acace7', 'message': 'Add deploy-swift-rings.sh script

This script makes it possible to deploy updated Swift rings (or any
other files, for that matter) in a deterministic and consistent way.
The proposed mechanism ensures that a (ring) file is updated only if the
previous file version matches a known checksum.

Example how to use this:

 mkdir -p etc/swift/
 echo "hello" > etc/swift/samplefile
 echo "helloworld" > etc/swift/samplefile.new
 md5sums etc/swift/samplefile > etc/swift/ring_checksums.txt
 tar cvzf swift-rings.tar.gz etc/swift/*
 upload-swift-artifacts -f swift-rings.tar.gz

After deployment is done, there should be only a file
/etc/swift/samplefile with the content "hello world".

This patch adds the required action only to the Controller and
ObjectStorage roles. The default behavior is not changed by this patch.

Change-Id: I551151d92eefd5e4391a610b22e47c2833ef0564

commit_message:
Fetch and deploy Swift rings built on the undercloud

This script fetches Swift rings that have been created on the
undercloud node using a temporary URL.

This patch adds the required action only to the Controller and
ObjectStorage roles. It also disables the previous ringbuilding,
which run a Puppet ringbuilding on each overcloud node.

An additional Hiera file is deployed to setup required disks.

Depends-On: I496b65dc53c03c0711d21f98627cc21be653ca5d
Depends-On: I8741acc8afa1f1d23c5b25fa4bf27622f674a561
Depends-On: Id0659a60958c467b061ba88f3ddd69ed731210ac

Change-Id: I551151d92eefd5e4391a610b22e47c2833ef0564
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/98/406198/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Modify variable's using method in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code,
rather than being done at the point of the logging call.
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation
For example:
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: Iff1f7fb82ca2d5b726681728f4140f37da7b3ca3
Closes-Bug: #1643463

commit_message:
Fix status not displayed in response for notification

Command openstack notification list, create, show doesn't display status
in the response.

Added 'status' field in the notification resource and 'columns' list
of _show_notification() method to fix this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1653098
Change-Id: Idcbc7310c20c333072ea02836ae3c29f836970af

commit_message:
Fixed 7 tests running twice in v3 identity

While working on another patch set, I noticed that the tests I had
added were being ran twice, which lead me to finding that all of the
tests within UserSelfServiceChangingPasswordsTestCase were being ran
again when the PasswordValidationTestCase tests were being ran.

Before: http://paste.openstack.org/show/593932/
After: http://paste.openstack.org/show/593933/
Diff: http://paste.openstack.org/compare/593933/593932/

This appears to be due to how PasswordValidationTestCase
was inheriting UserSelfServiceChangingPasswordsTestCase in order to
reuse a couple functions. This change moves the reused methods into
their own test class to be inherited by both test cases.

Change-Id: I597eb2760eee9a248421df166d81961b11eb4b75
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/65/416765/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

check list to determine if weighed_hosts is null

commit_message:
Restrict snapshot deletion if it's used for shares

Now share snapshot can be deleted even if the share(s) created from it
still exist(s). This is unreasonable and should be fixed.

This patch does:
*Add the function in db api to return the shares with given snapshot ID;
*Add the check of shares created from the specified snapshot before deleting it.
*Add the related unit test function.

Change-Id: Ie6f5e5f0123ed0beec12a35870e58a4b79bcc8bb
Closes-Bug: #1400813

DB sync

Develop the function.

No new features

commit_message:
Update method cfg.set_defaults


Cors has been added setdefaults method, It allows overriding the
configuration defaults, both for runtime execution and for config
generation.So I think we can update old method.

Change-Id: I0c6dda18426a1293e4266f3b4a9b779479fbedb7

commit_message:
Fix creating a private flavor with ID auto

When a private flavor is created with ID auto (=default) and a project
is specified for it, instead of trying to add the project to the flavor
called "auto" the ID of the newly created project should be used.

Change-Id: I19f7a0ec26bd5d147f00ecba3312240e3601567e
Closes-Bug: 1654221

commit_message:
nova-status: check for compute resource providers

This adds an upgrade check for resource providers which
builds on the cells v2 and placement API checks, so it
changes how upgrade_checks is processed so it's a list
of checks run in order rather than just a dict of things
that can be run independently.

The check added here is relying on the API DB for resource
provider information since Nova does not yet support a
separate placement database.

It also allows for a fresh base install where there are no
resource providers or compute nodes and does not consider
that a failure.

Part of blueprint resource-providers-scheduler-db-filters

Change-Id: I5d316144b3ee63027f3ad5f0984df6cb22f16249
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/50/413250/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova import context as nova_contextPLACEMENT_DOCS_LINK = 'http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/placement.html' def _count_compute_nodes(self, context=None): # TODO(mriedem): Do we need to filter out compute nodes that have a # related disabled service because if the nova-compute service for the # compute host is disabled, we probably don't want to count those # computes against resource providers since you can't schedule to them # anyway. For a disabled compute service, you'll either have 0 or 1 # resource providers depending on if the service is actually still # running on the host, and if it has the placement code deployed in # Newton. Worst case scenario is it's a rogue Newton compute node not # reporting resource providers and we ultimately count RPs < CNs and # end up with a warning status for the upgrade check. meta = MetaData(bind=db_session.get_engine(context=context)) @staticmethod def _count_resource_providers(): """Returns the number of resource providers in the API database.""" # TODO(mriedem): If/when we support a separate placement database this # will need to change to just use the REST API. meta = MetaData(bind=db_session.get_api_engine()) resource_providers = Table('resource_providers', meta, autoload=True) return select([sqlfunc.count()]).select_from( resource_providers).scalar() @staticmethod def _get_non_cell0_mappings(): """Queries the API database for non-cell0 cell mappings.""" meta = MetaData(bind=db_session.get_api_engine()) cell_mappings = Table('cell_mappings', meta, autoload=True) return cell_mappings.select().where( cell_mappings.c.uuid != cell_mapping_obj.CellMapping.CELL0_UUID).execute().fetchall() def _check_resource_providers(self): """Checks the status of resource provider reporting. This check relies on the cells v2 check passing because it queries the cells for compute nodes using cell mappings. This check relies on the placement service running because if it's not then there won't be any resource providers for the filter scheduler to use during instance build and move requests. """ # Get the total count of resource providers from the API DB. This might # be 0 so we have to figure out if this is a fresh install and if so we # don't consider this an error. num_rps = self._count_resource_providers() cell_mappings = self._get_non_cell0_mappings() ctxt = nova_context.get_admin_context() num_computes = 0 for cell_mapping in cell_mappings: with nova_context.target_cell(ctxt, cell_mapping): num_computes += self._count_compute_nodes(ctxt) else: # There are no cell mappings, cells v2 was maybe not deployed in # Newton, but placement might have been, so let's check the single # database for compute nodes. num_computes = self._count_compute_nodes() if num_rps == 0: if num_computes != 0: # This is a failure because there are compute nodes in the # database but nothing is reporting resource providers to the # placement service. msg = (_('There are no resource providers in the Placement ' 'service but there are %(num_computes)s compute ' 'nodes in the deployment. This means no compute ' 'nodes are reporting into the Placement service and ' 'need to be upgraded and/or fixed. See ' '%(placement_docs_link)s for more details.') % {'num_computes': num_computes, 'placement_docs_link': PLACEMENT_DOCS_LINK}) return UpgradeCheckResult(UpgradeCheckCode.FAILURE, msg) # There are no resource providers and no compute nodes so we # assume this is a fresh install and move on. We should return a # success code with a message here though. msg = (_('There are no resource providers in the Placement ' 'service nor are there compute nodes in the database. ' 'Remember to configure new compute nodes to report into ' 'the Placement service. See %(placement_docs_link)s ' 'for more details.') % {'placement_docs_link': PLACEMENT_DOCS_LINK}) return UpgradeCheckResult(UpgradeCheckCode.SUCCESS, msg) elif num_rps < num_computes: # There are fewer resource providers than compute nodes, so return # a warning explaining that the deployment might be underutilized. msg = (_('There are %(num_resource_providers)s resource providers ' 'and %(num_compute_nodes)s compute nodes in the ' 'deployment. Ideally the number of resource providers ' 'should be greater than or equal to the number of ' 'enabled compute nodes otherwise the cloud may be ' 'underutilized. See %(placement_docs_link)s for more ' 'details.') % {'num_resource_providers': num_rps, 'num_compute_nodes': num_computes, 'placement_docs_link': PLACEMENT_DOCS_LINK}) return UpgradeCheckResult(UpgradeCheckCode.WARNING, msg) else: # TODO(mriedem): what if we have resource providers but no # compute nodes? # We have RPs >= CNs which is what we want to see. return UpgradeCheckResult(UpgradeCheckCode.SUCCESS) # be rolled up at the end of the check() function. These functions are # intended to be run in order and build on top of each other so order # matters. _upgrade_checks = ( (_('Cells v2'), _check_cellsv2), (_('Placement API'), _check_placement), # Added in Ocata (_('Resource Providers'), _check_resource_providers), ) for name, func in self._upgrade_checks:
deleted_lines: def _count_compute_nodes(self): meta = MetaData(bind=db_session.get_engine()) # TODO(mriedem): The placement service is running, fun! Now let's query # the API DB to count the number of resource providers and compare that # to the number of compute nodes (probably across all cells?). If there # are no resource providers it's a clear fail. If there are fewer RPs # than computes then it's a warning because you might be underutilized. # be rolled up at the end of the check() function. _upgrade_checks = { _('Cells v2'): _check_cellsv2, _('Placement API'): _check_placement, } # Sort the checks by name so that we have predictable test results. for name in sorted(self._upgrade_checks.keys()): func = self._upgrade_checks[name]

commit_message:
Have scenario tests retrive guest log on error

As an aid to debug guest failures, a Metaclass was added
to the TestRunner class that allows failed tests to
pull back and echo the guest log from 'registered'
instances.

This uses the guest-log feature that is available for
all datastores.

IDs for instances created in the tests were registered
to report on failures.

Two guest-log tests were also commented out, as they
seem to not work properly: see
https://bugs.launchpad.net/trove/+bug/1653614
This was discovered while testing the new retrieval
code.  Other tests were also modified so that
'SkipTest' exceptions would be raised properly.

Change-Id: I448bd2f0181351ef1536e20c41f9d45f95478587
Partial-Bug: 1652964

subject: Fix python integer interpretation in Py2 and Py3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-23 06:10:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/d60156d2420cf318b81d1b5a9ecd19b42a86b517', 'message': 'Fix python integer interpretation in Py2 and Py3

If user passes large number "11111111111111111111111111111" as size to
the create volume api, then the api behaves inconsistently depending
on whether the cinder-api service is running on Py2 and Py3.
In case of Py2, it returns following error message:

ERROR: Invalid input received: Volume size '11111111111111111111111111111'
must be an integer and greater than 0 (HTTP 400) (Request-ID: req-abe6cd5
e-a0c6-4e0d-ba05-c9eceef547bf)

But in case of Py3, it passes this validation.

This patch fixes this inconsistency issue by checking isinstance(size, int)
to isinstance(size, six.integer_types).

NOTE:
The unit test written in the patch will fail on master on Py2 environment
and it's written to just ensure that the issue is resolved for Py2.

Closes-Bug: #1651103
Change-Id: Ib43b96d458f0d4e9477886bd19c35a7e05664929
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-04 10:51:11.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/flows/test_create_volume_flow.py', 'cinder/volume/flows/api/create_volume.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/c03c2fa70dabce689f0b6b86411997e0e24fcd5c', 'message': 'Fix python integer interpretation in Py2 and Py3

If user passes large number "11111111111111111111111111111" as size to

on whether the cinder-api service is running on Py2 and Py3.
In case of Py2, it returns following error message:

ERROR: Invalid input received: Volume size '11111111111111111111111111111'

e-a0c6-4e0d-ba05-c9eceef547bf)

But in case of Py3, it passes this validation.

This patch fixes this inconsistency issue by checking isinstance(size, int)
to isinstance(size, six.integer_types).

NOTE:
The unit test written in the patch will fail on master on Py2 environment
and it's written to just ensure that the issue is resolved for Py2.

Closes-Bug: #1651103
Change-Id: Ib43b96d458f0d4e9477886bd19c35a7e05664929
'}]
commit_message:
Fix python integer interpretation in Py2 and Py3

If user passes large number "11111111111111111111111111111" as size to
the create volume api, then the api behaves inconsistently depending
on whether the cinder-api service is running on Py2 and Py3.
In case of Py2, it returns following error message:

ERROR: Invalid input received: Volume size '11111111111111111111111111111'
must be an integer and greater than 0 (HTTP 400) (Request-ID: req-abe6cd5
e-a0c6-4e0d-ba05-c9eceef547bf)

But in case of Py3, it passes this validation.

This patch fixes this inconsistency issue by checking isinstance(size, int)
to isinstance(size, six.integer_types).

NOTE:
The unit test written in the patch will fail on master on Py2 environment
and it's written to just ensure that the issue is resolved for Py2.

Closes-Bug: #1651103
Change-Id: Ib43b96d458f0d4e9477886bd19c35a7e05664929
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/29/414429/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six if not isinstance(size, six.integer_types) or size <= 0:
deleted_lines: if not isinstance(size, int) or size <= 0:

commit_message:
Revise Log.Warning in leave operation

When do senlin-node-del command, warning log is not correct.
This patch revises this issue.
2017-01-06 11:53:35.324 WARNING ... Join operation not specialized.
2017-01-06 11:53:35.452 INFO ... end: Node successfully left cluster.
2017-01-06 11:53:37.697 INFO ...  end: Completed deleting nodes.

Change-Id: I724da330e344e48644988bcbd016cc5ce67e6058

commit_message:
doc: add recomendation for delete notifications

Based on the mail discussion [1] I think we should use the same payload
for delete, create, update notifications of the same entity.
This will help keep the notifications more consistent and easier
to filter.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-December/109501.html

Change-Id: If4237b111ffb0e8511b6a73c57807b9bd4addf80
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/91/415991/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * The delete notification should contain the same information as the create or update notifications. This makes possible for the consumer to listen only to the delete notifications but still filter on some fields of the entity (e.g. project_id).
deleted_lines: * You should not include those parts of the entity that are unchanged or static in relation to the event you are sending the notification about. So that you can limit the size of the payload and avoid unnecessary repetition.

commit_message:
Add ANSIBLE_TEST_PLUGINS env variable

This change ensures that the new greater/less than tests from
openstack-ansible-plugins is included in the integrated repo. This
change is required for the RHEL 7 STIG integration in the security
role.

Change-Id: I33865e2c81e8d4256c6793380e40762568a9476f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/58/416358/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export ANSIBLE_TEST_PLUGINS="${ANSIBLE_TEST_PLUGINS):-/etc/ansible/roles/plugins/test}"

commit_message:
zun exec syntax changed similar to docker

Here is the syntax right now:

  $ zun exec -c "echo hello" test
  hello
I think it is better to change it to:

  $ zun exec test "echo hello"

This will be more intuitive and consistent with docker CLI.

Closes-Bug: #1654005

Change-Id: I632a5c7bbf6c21c58f3aaf43bbc32c5fe9f7ccf8

subject: Api-ref update for filter "user_id" in receiver list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-04 09:10:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/senlin/commit/99c066eaff73f6d7c96fc486e74d0a448260cfa4', 'message': 'Api-ref update for filter "user_id" in receiver list

commit_message:
Bump max micro-version for V1 API to 1.4

This bumps the global maximum micro-version of V1 API to 1.4, thus opens
the door for senlin API to serve requests for 1.4 APIs.

Change-Id: Iffff1633e1a66b63c7e2b137e523d49b1cd4a48a

commit_message:
temprevert neutron "Don't create HA resources until needed" patch

https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1654032/

Reverting a Neutron patch until it's fixed upstream.
Note: do not revert when the job run in Neutron's gate.

Change-Id: Ic3ea505e877608bc9d9c529b698a5068a67461a4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/74/416974/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1654032/ # we don't want to revert the patch for neutron's gate because they're # trying to fix it at this time and need the broken patch. if [[ "${ZUUL_PROJECT}" != "openstack/neutron" ]]; then temprevert neutron 2ad9c679ed8718633732da1e97307f9fd9647dcc 1654032 fi

commit_message:
Fix the Monasca API tempest tests

The Tempest Manager class must have changed and the service
argument apparently no longer exists. Instead, it was being set
as the scope which caused the catalog to not be retrieved

Change-Id: If934bac4e2cd833fe4e381c373218383354969ec

commit_message:
Add filter "user_id" for cluster receiver list

This patch adds "user_id" to cluster receiver's query map,
so that user can get the required result when doing cluster
receiver list.

Partial-Bug: #1653613

commit_message:
parameter value wrongly mapped in vnfd

In VNFD template, if we give 'sriov' value to the name property,
it is then converted to 'direct' in the heat template.

Solution: before changing the value, key-name is checked now

Change-Id: Ib7d96c7fccc781bc0615670ddf90bba4dcbdf24c
closes-bug: #1648003

deleted_lines: convert_prop_values = {TACKERCP: {'sriov': 'direct', 'vnic': 'normal'}} if nt.type in convert_prop_values: for key in convert_prop_values[nt.type].keys(): for p in nt.get_properties_objects(): if key == p.value: v = convert_prop_values[nt.type][p.value] p.value = v

commit_message:
Fix test variable injection in CI

* Migration is not a multi-backend only feature.
* Snapshot tests, Shrink tests and Quota test flags
  should have appropriate devstack variables.

Closes-Bug: 1652150

Change-Id: I7a83981045c03bcc605ec0119a4b425fb5f9e987

commit_message:
Replace always if resource is in CHECK_FAILED

We mark resource unhealthy as CHECK_FAILED, so we
need to always replace when a resource is in
CHECK_FAILED.

Change-Id: I0837d1818fb2f6f4e97131d32f750d70f67fa82b
Blueprint: custom-update-replace-for-failed-resources

commit_message:
Image signature documentation modify barbican auth_endpoint

Add a configuration section to the image signature documentation
describing how to change the keystone endpoint of barbican if
keystone is not on localhost.

If auth_endpoint is incorrect then image signing will fail as barbican
will not be able to connect to keystone.

DocImpact

Added an example of changing the auth_endpoint.

Closes-Bug: 1620539

Change-Id: I8f8978f0c0dfc337e917c4d710dc8db1351070d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/40/364840/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Configuration ------------- The etc/glance-api.conf can be modified to change keystone endpoint of barbican. By default barbican will try to connect to keystone at http://localhost:5000/v3 but if keystone is on another host then this should be changed. In glance-api.conf find the following lines:: [barbican] auth_endpoint = http://localhost:5000/v3 Then change localhost to the IP address of keystone. .. note:: If those lines do not exist then simply add them to the end of the file.

commit_message:
Remove redundant import code

We have initialized the import oslo_i18n in /heat/__init__.py,
such as'import oslo_i18n as i18n', so, the whole files in the directory
of heat that will only be included 'import i18n', which can make the
code smaller and clear.

Change-Id: I76c71b21d36fcc4940ba3550f5d82bc0532e971d
closes-bug: 1629180
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/51/379951/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove references to Python 3.4

Now that there exists only a gate job for Python 3.5 and not 3.4,
we should remove those references to the 3.4 that is untested.

Change-Id: I77626618b9c8a61017df3e28c10a779a54422080

commit_message:
Fix issues with keystone-dsvm-py35-functional-v3-only on py35

keystone/token/providers/fernet/token_formatters.py
* decode payload[2] from bytes to string before comparing
  with a string (CONF.identity.default_domain_id)

keystone_tempest_plugin/services/identity/clients.py
keystone_tempest_plugin/services/identity/v3/auth_client.py
keystone_tempest_plugin/services/identity/v3/identity_providers_client.py
* decode the response body from bytes to string before we
  try to parse the json using json.loads

Change-Id: I98053bc498d78c5f0076a66e725ff2d634f5b663
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/00/412500/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Explicitly state that 406 will be raised

This patch adds some text to the API reference stating that users may
get a 406 exception if the micro-version specified is out of range.

Change-Id: If48b6f39733cdf57cdd3a726123ddeca990d10a8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/08/416908/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: When the specified ``OpenStack-API-Version`` is not supported by the API service, a 406 (NotAcceptable) exception will be raised. Note that this applies to all API requests documented in this guide.

commit_message:
Remove conditional "if child:" in _create_nodes

Conditional "if child:" in _create_nodes is useless.
This patch removes this logic.
Also it can promote unit test coverage.

Change-Id: Ia05c37f4953edb101e0b4e9a93ac1aa3177f90ac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/93/416893/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(ab.Action, 'create') @mock.patch.object(co.Cluster, 'get_next_index') @mock.patch.object(nm, 'Node') def test__create_nodes_child_len_zero(self, mock_node, mock_index, mock_action, mock_load): # prepare mocks cluster = mock.Mock(id='CLUSTER_ID', profile_id='FAKE_PROFILE', user='FAKE_USER', project='FAKE_PROJECT', domain='FAKE_DOMAIN') mock_index.return_value = 123 node = mock.Mock(id='NODE_ID') mock_node.return_value = node mock_load.return_value = cluster action = ca.ClusterAction(cluster.id, 'CLUSTER_ACTION', self.ctx) # node_action return '' mock_action.return_value = None # do it res_code, res_msg = action._create_nodes(1) # assertions self.assertEqual(action.RES_OK, res_code) self.assertEqual('', res_msg)

subject: Add legacy sNAT rule to l3_proactive_app
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-22 09:41:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow/commit/b66c7361b70b2a73d9d15e487d50af567cf454a7', 'message': 'Add legacy sNAT rule to l3_proactive_app

Add a default rule to l3_proactive_app, that will pass the packet to the
router interface. The router interface will then route the packet out
using sNAT.

Move PUBLIC_BRIDGE (and related) configuration to settings, so that they
will be picked up by devstack when setting up the l3 agent, so that the
outgoing router interface in the namespace will be connected to the
external bridge.

Future patches on this bug will include:
* Same fix for l3_app.py (reactive)
* Fullstack tests
* Move relevant code to its own application

This patch is partial to allow sNAT to work again.

Related-Bug: #1651988
Change-Id: Ic3054632272ee2bfdfeba2f9f696b512f884b9ef
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-25 08:42:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow/commit/bd0bf955b975c5abcaeaffa1bcaad000c5ee539f', 'message': 'Add legacy sNAT rule to l3_proactive_app

Add a default rule to l3_proactive_app, that will pass the packet to the
router interface. The router interface will then route the packet out
using sNAT.

Move PUBLIC_BRIDGE (and related) configuration to settings, so that they
will be picked up by devstack when setting up the l3 agent, so that the
outgoing router interface in the namespace will be connected to the
external bridge.

Future patches on this bug will include:
* Same fix for l3_app.py (reactive)
* Fullstack tests
* Move relevant code to its own application

This patch is partial to allow sNAT to work again.

commit_message:
Add legacy sNAT rule to l3_proactive_app

Add a default rule to l3_proactive_app, that will pass the packet to the
router interface. The router interface will then route the packet out
using sNAT.

Move PUBLIC_BRIDGE (and related) configuration to settings, so that they
will be picked up by devstack when setting up the l3 agent, so that the
outgoing router interface in the namespace will be connected to the
external bridge.

Future patches on this bug will include:
* Same fix for l3_app.py (reactive)
* Fullstack tests
* Move relevant code to its own application

This patch is partial to allow sNAT to work again.

Related-Bug: #1651988
Change-Id: Ic3054632272ee2bfdfeba2f9f696b512f884b9ef

commit_message:
Merge mysql service_config_settings for nova

The hieradata from the nova-base.yaml service template needs to be available to
the role running mysql, which isn't necessarily the same role as nova.

nova-base.yaml isn't an actual service template though that is included in any
ServiceChain resources, it's outputs need to be merged with an actual nova
service template, such as nova-api.yaml.

As nova-api.yaml already provides some hieradata for the mysql service in
service_config_settings, this patch uses map_merge to combine the 2 values.

Change-Id: I4dc684b3611b13f177f9499e69468d3f6ef6fa76
Closes-Bug: #1654058

For now, this is the default cell # created for the cell v2 configuration nova::db::mysql_api::setup_cell0: true nova::rabbit_password: {get_param: RabbitPassword} nova::rabbit_userid: {get_param: RabbitUserName} nova::rabbit_use_ssl: {get_param: RabbitClientUseSSL} nova::rabbit_port: {get_param: RabbitClientPort}
deleted_lines: service_config_settings: mysql: # NOTE(aschultz): this should be configurable if/when we support more # complex cell v2 configurations. For now, this is the default cell # created for the cell v2 configuration nova::db::mysql_api::setup_cell0: true nova::rabbit_password: {get_param: RabbitPassword} nova::rabbit_userid: {get_param: RabbitUserName} nova::rabbit_use_ssl: {get_param: RabbitClientUseSSL} nova::rabbit_port: {get_param: RabbitClientPort}

commit_message:
Remove name attribute from help of notification show

Notification does not have name attribute and it can be retrieved
using UUID only, so it should not show name in the help message of
notification show.

Corrected help message of notification show to display UUID only.

Closes-bug: #1653090

Change-Id: Ifc12997e677f8cdbf802cb9adac01e13ba50a9ea

commit_message:
Use assertGreater(len(x), y) instead of assertTrue(len(x) > y)

assertGreater provides a nicer error message if it fails.

Change-Id: Ib5af15c8bdca84bea3db924ee55fb8d6ae212590

commit_message:
Make Nova/Ironic communication use Identity v3

As long as nova already supports an Identity v3 auth flow when talking
to ironic (Id837d26bb21c158de0504627e488c0692aef1e24), make it use
v3 by default.

This way we don't fail in a keystone v3-only situation, for
example.

Change-Id: I028dfb52108d0630f47a53f8b420b70d4979eb55
(cherry picked from commit 57df186c132c522231aab1e577d879f7fa51c992)

commit_message:
Fix: nested resources are ignored

The current "resource-list" method in Tacker just mentioned to
the first-layered resources. Meanwhile scaling feature used the
nested template which contains VNF discription. Therefore, the nested
resources are ignored in the scaling case. This spec will fix this issue.

Co-Authored-By: venkatamahesh <Venkata.Kotha@infinite.com>
Closes-Bug: #1629028

Change-Id: I0a4258873f7898a009a155f2b048638cdbc581d9

commit_message:
Improve help text for events-list command options

events-list command's help text for some options does not follow common
format. Also, *-events-list commands have similar issues. This patch
fixes help texts for these commands to make them clearer for users.

Change-Id: Icd85d13fee437bf0f83979eb6625377b38ce39ad
Closes-bug: #1628769

added_lines: class ListEventsBase(tackerV10.ListCommand): """Base class for list command.""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(ListEventsBase, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument('--id', help='id of the event to look up.') parser.add_argument('--resource_id', help='resource id of the events to look up.') parser.add_argument('--resource_state', help='resource state of the events to look up.') parser.add_argument('--event_type', help='event type of the events to look up.') return parser def args2search_opts(self, parsed_args): search_opts = super(ListEventsBase, self).args2search_opts( parsed_args) if parsed_args.id: search_opts.update({'id': parsed_args.id}) if parsed_args.resource_id: search_opts.update({'resource_id': parsed_args.resource_id}) if parsed_args.resource_state: search_opts.update({'resource_state': parsed_args.resource_state}) if parsed_args.event_type: search_opts.update({'event_type': parsed_args.event_type}) return search_opts class ListResourceEvents(ListEventsBase): """List events of all resource types.""" resource = _EVENT def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(ListResourceEvents, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument('--resource_type', help='resource type of the events to look up.') return parser def args2search_opts(self, parsed_args): search_opts = super(ListResourceEvents, self).args2search_opts( parsed_args) if parsed_args.resource_type: search_opts.update({'resource_type': parsed_args.resource_type}) return search_opts class ListVNFEvents(ListEventsBase): """List events of VNFs."""class ListVNFDEvents(ListEventsBase): """List events of VNFDs."""class ListVIMEvents(ListEventsBase): """List events of VIMs."""

[www-ko_KR] Publish install-guide (Newton)
