commit_message:
Allow all tcp ports at the end of postci

Once we get to this point in the run, we've run all the tests so
it shouldn't impact anything functional to do this, and then we can
stop burning time trying to debug this problem that now only seems
to be happening on the mitaka branch.

Change-Id: Id92700f32d6ddf33480d4c448544158363c3943f
Closes-Bug: 1649742
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/42/414342/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Allow all ports before we finish up. This should avoid # https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1649742 which we've now spent far # too much time debugging. It's currently only happening on the mitaka # branch anyway, so once that branch goes EOL we can probably remove this. sudo iptables -I INPUT -p tcp -j ACCEPT

subject: Handling HTTP range requests in Glance
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-08 17:12:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/84a8de7a26a60dbf5ab7e394c44f2c42e6628f47', 'message': 'Handling HTTP range requests in Glance

Currently Glance does not send Partial response codes while
handling HTTP range requests. Also, content length is not
appropriately set.

This patch is to send partial response code upon success,
determine the satisfiable range if range is not satisfiable
and enable download of that range and send partial response
code. If there is no satisfiable range, match with appropriate
exception and set appropriate partial response code.

Change-Id: I3cd47b998be79604511b3cd4879209820cf776b7
Closes-Bug: #1417069
Related-Bug: #1399851
Related-Bug: #1618928
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-13 22:44:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/c6443f176f4920b738f2a53d3be52bd738378511', 'message': 'Handling HTTP range requests in Glance

Currently Glance does not send Partial response codes while
handling HTTP range requests. Also, content length is not
appropriately set.

This patch is to send partial response code and to set the correct
content length based on the range request for image download.
Upon success status code 206 is sent and the content length is set to the
requested range.
Upon failure,  status code is set to 416 and appropriate exceptions are raised.

NOTE: A bad range request is handled by glance/common/wsgi.by by raising a
"HTTPBadrequest: Malformed Content-Range header".

Change-Id: I3cd47b998be79604511b3cd4879209820cf776b7
Closes-Bug: #1417069
Related-Bug: #1399851
Related-Bug: #1618928
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-13 23:37:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/63dbba5e11d36aab331279d822f4667f2667e7d6', 'message': 'Handling HTTP range requests in Glance

Currently Glance does not send Partial response codes while
handling HTTP range requests. Also, content length is not
appropriately set.

This patch is to send partial response code and to set the correct
content length based on the range request for image download.

Upon success status code 206 is sent and the content length is set to the
requested range.
Upon failure, there can be 2 cases:
 * If the HTTP range request for the image download is bad (For example,
   requesting download of range of bytes 10 to 50 bytes when there are only 48
   bytes), status code is set to 416 and HTTPRequestRangeNotSatisfiable is
   raised.
 * If the content range is valid, but the request is not satisfiable due to
   glance_store side erros or privacy issues, appropriate exceptions are
   raised but content range set to the requested range that was valid.

Change-Id: I3cd47b998be79604511b3cd4879209820cf776b7
Closes-Bug: #1417069
Related-Bug: #1399851
Related-Bug: #1618928

commit_message:
Handling HTTP range requests in Glance

Currently Glance does not send Partial response codes while
handling HTTP range requests. Also, content length is not
appropriately set.

This patch is to send partial response code and to set the correct
content length based on the range request for image download.

Upon success status code 206 is sent and the content length is set to the
requested range.
Upon failure, there can be 2 cases:
 * If the HTTP range request for the image download is bad (For example,
   requesting download of range of bytes 10 to 50 bytes when there are only 48
   bytes), status code is set to 416 and HTTPRequestRangeNotSatisfiable is
   raised.
 * If the content range is valid, but the request is not satisfiable due to
   glance_store side erros or privacy issues, appropriate exceptions are
   raised.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1417069
Closes-Bug: #1624508
Closes-Bug: #1399851
Closes-Bug: #1618928

Change-Id: I3cd47b998be79604511b3cd4879209820cf776b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/28/367528/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_download_with_range(self): request = wsgi.Request.blank('/') request.environ = {} request.headers['Content-Range'] = 'bytes %s-%s/3' % (1, 2) response = webob.Response() response.request = request image = FakeImage(size=3, data=[b'Z', b'Z', b'Z']) self.serializer.download(response, image) self.assertEqual(206, response.status_code) self.assertEqual('2', response.headers['Content-Length']) def test_download_failure_with_range(self): with mock.patch.object(glance.api.policy.ImageProxy, 'get_data') as mock_get_data: mock_get_data.side_effect = glance_store.NotFound(image="image") request = wsgi.Request.blank('/') request.environ = {} request.headers['Content-Range'] = 'bytes %s-%s/3' % (1, 2) response = webob.Response() response.request = request image = FakeImage(size=3, data=[b'Z', b'Z', b'Z']) image.get_data = mock_get_data self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPNoContent, self.serializer.download, response, image) self.assertEqual(416, response.status_code)

commit_message:
Use base.delete_server in addCleanup

The multi lines of addCleanup of server can be replaced by one calling
to addCleanup(base.delete_server)

Change-Id: I15d179b7131ada87c5a8841459adb81ddc7f56ab

deleted_lines: from tempest.common import waiters self.addCleanup(waiters.wait_for_server_termination, self.servers_client, server['id']) self.addCleanup(self.servers_client.delete_server, server['id'])

commit_message:
Make last remaining unit tests work with Neutron by default

After this change all of nova/tests/unit should pass with
CONF.use_neutron=True by default. The functional tests still
need to be worked on but that's a later patch.

(cherry picked from commit 41b4e456efa7ee489b01fc8881107f1d278b3b40)

Change-Id: Iec5985c1a5f42778ba0e94b38baaf9727cf77660

commit_message:
Add test namespace object functions in images

Related link:
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/metadefs-index.html

Co-Authored-By: guo yunxian <yunxian.guo@easystack.cn>
Change-Id: Ic60e3c78ade0eefe21f79c6bfb716beb13b08483
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/59/389159/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2013 IBM Corp. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_serialization import jsonutils as json from tempest.lib.common import rest_client class NamespaceObjectsClient(rest_client.RestClient): api_version = "v2" def list_namespace_objects(self, namespace_id, **kwargs): """Lists all namespace objects. For a full list of available parameters, please refer to the official API reference: http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/metadefs-index.html?expanded=list-objects-detail """ url = 'metadefs/namespaces/%s/objects' % namespace_id resp, body = self.get(url) self.expected_success(200, resp.status) body = json.loads(body) return rest_client.ResponseBody(resp, body) def create_namespace_object(self, namespace_id, **kwargs): """Create a namespace object For a full list of available parameters, please refer to the official API reference: http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/metadefs-index.html?expanded=create-object-detail """ url = 'metadefs/namespaces/%s/objects' % namespace_id data = json.dumps(kwargs) resp, body = self.post(url, data) self.expected_success(201, resp.status) body = json.loads(body) return rest_client.ResponseBody(resp, body) def update_namespace_object(self, namespace_id, object_id, **kwargs): """Update a namespace object For a full list of available parameters, please refer to the official API reference: http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/metadefs-index.html?expanded=update-object-detail """ url = 'metadefs/namespaces/%s/objects/%s' % (namespace_id, object_id) data = json.dumps(kwargs) resp, body = self.put(url, data) self.expected_success(200, resp.status) body = json.loads(body) return rest_client.ResponseBody(resp, body) def show_namespace_object(self, namespace_id, object_id): """Show a namespace object For a full list of available parameters, please refer to the official API reference: http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/metadefs-index.html?expanded=show-object-detail """ url = 'metadefs/namespaces/%s/objects/%s' % (namespace_id, object_id) resp, body = self.get(url) self.expected_success(200, resp.status) body = json.loads(body) return rest_client.ResponseBody(resp, body) def delete_namespace_object(self, namespace_id, object_id): """Create a namespace object For a full list of available parameters, please refer to the official API reference: http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/metadefs-index.html?expanded=delete-object-detail """ url = 'metadefs/namespaces/%s/objects/%s' % (namespace_id, object_id) resp, _ = self.delete(url) self.expected_success(204, resp.status) return rest_client.ResponseBody(resp)

commit_message:
Drop pre-seeding results from old runs

Per @mtreinish,
"Preloading the scheduler never seemed to make a noticeable difference"

Also this interferes with python3 experiments. So let's just
yank it out.

Change-Id: I0df5c95017b5bbcd611acd7ef499c58686c2868d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-02 10:35:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/7a42315d861d9075c41d6d61b398461e26fe0018', 'message': 'NetApp: set proper broadcast domain for IPspace

When DHSS=True, the cDOT driver creates vservers to act as
manila share servers and sets up LIFs within the vservers
as export locations using physical ports.  The LIFs in the
NetApp cluster may use overlapping addresses provided that
they are put in separate IPspaces and the physical ports
underneath them are put in corresponding broadcast domains.

commit_message:
NetApp: set proper broadcast domain for IPspace

When DHSS=True, the cDOT driver creates vservers to act as
manila share servers and sets up LIFs within the vservers
as export locations using physical ports.  The LIFs in the
NetApp cluster may use overlapping addresses provided that
they are put in separate IPspaces and the physical ports
underneath them are put in corresponding broadcast domains.

Fix the cDOT driver to maintain a proper 1-1 relation between
IPSpaces and broadcast domains as documented here [1].

[1] https://library.netapp.com/ecmdocs/ECMP1636021/html/GUID-CB9BD2E2-D085-446E-8EB2-6BF609E42ABA.html

Change-Id: I32968e82cc679bb7efe492f3ca980e16e5e29c83
Closes-bug: #1646603

commit_message:
Install also Cinder V2 and V3 endpoints when Cinder is enabled

Otherwise we end up with only deprecated V1 configured correctly.

Also fix incorrect glance URL (should be external).

Part of blueprint undercloud-boot-from-volume
Change-Id: I1abb7401b26e3a5826ff46f42b0034582cf4966b

commit_message:
Fix Cisco Initiator zoning updates

Instead of current methodology of deleting and recreating zones in
order to update WWPN members, changed logic to perform a zone_update
to modify existing zonemembers for a given zone. Fix prevents targets
from losing connectivity to initiators during an update.

Change-Id: I023ffaa2d4185c686a886675f931d5da522a9591
Closes-Bug: #1611043

subject: Bump minimum rfc3986 to address url formatting bug
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-05 15:32:52.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/e978b0d1b4d701a96c22a2470f54498fd8e2ec6e', 'message': "Bump minimum rfc3986 to address url formatting bug

rfc3986 < 0.3.1 incorrectly rejects urls with '-' in the
hostname. There is an ubuntu bug that's been marked against projects
for this. We should bump our minimum to ensure that consumers realize
this is an issue.

Change-Id: I7a25dcc8405addfefd157fca8314dacd3aea169e
Closes-Bug: #1653967
"}]
commit_message:
Bump minimum rfc3986 to address url formatting bug

rfc3986 < 0.3.1 incorrectly rejects urls with '-' in the
hostname. There is an ubuntu bug that's been marked against projects
for this. We should bump our minimum to ensure that consumers realize
this is an issue.

Change-Id: I7a25dcc8405addfefd157fca8314dacd3aea169e
Closes-Bug: #1653967
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/17/417017/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Move try-again loop around all data methods

The verify-data method will try multiple times to
see if the data is on the node in question.  This
functionality has been moved down the stack so that
all data methods (add, verify, remove) will attempt
multiple times.

Change-Id: Ic3ffce6cdcc1e7d98d484c30c65b6dc01535873a
Partial-Bug: 1652964
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/16/415516/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._perform_data_action('add', self.FN_ADD, data_type.name, host, *args, **kwargs) self._perform_data_action('remove', self.FN_REMOVE, data_type.name, host, *args, **kwargs) """ self._perform_data_action('verify', self.FN_VERIFY, data_type.name, host, *args, **kwargs) def _perform_data_action(self, label, fn_type, fn_name, host, *args, **kwargs): """By default, the action is attempted 10 times, sleeping for 3 fns = self._data_fns[fn_type] data_fn_name = self.data_fn_pattern % (fn_type, fn_name) fns[data_fn_name](self, host, *args, **kwargs) except SkipTest: raise except Exception as ex: self.report.log("Attempt %d to %s data type %s failed\n%s" % (attempts, label, fn_name, ex)) if attempts > retry_count: raise RuntimeError("Error calling %s from class %s - %s" % (data_fn_name, self.__class__.__name__, ex))
deleted_lines: self._perform_data_action(self.FN_ADD, data_type.name, host, *args, **kwargs) self._perform_data_action(self.FN_REMOVE, data_type.name, host, *args, **kwargs) By default, the verification is attempted 10 times, sleeping for 3 self._perform_data_action(self.FN_VERIFY, data_type.name, host, *args, **kwargs) except Exception as ex: self.report.log("Attempt %d to verify data type %s failed\n%s" % (attempts, data_type.name, ex)) if attempts > retry_count: raise def _perform_data_action(self, fn_type, fn_name, host, *args, **kwargs): fns = self._data_fns[fn_type] data_fn_name = self.data_fn_pattern % (fn_type, fn_name) try: fns[data_fn_name](self, host, *args, **kwargs) except SkipTest: raise except Exception as ex: raise RuntimeError("Error calling %s from class %s - %s" % (data_fn_name, self.__class__.__name__, ex))

commit_message:
Add support for bridge mappings

When OVN virtual networks wants to access the provider networks it does
so with the help of a special port type 'localnet'. For the localnet ports
to be present in the agent side, the agent has to carry some details
in the vswitch DB as well a bridge has to be setup for the same.

This patch help to setup up the bridge for provider network mapping and to
add appropriate interfaces to the bridge

Change-Id: Ia6d66fa954571328c0ac3542af17303def382c1a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ovn refs/changes/57/399557/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # define ovn::controller::bridge { include ::vswitch::ovs $map = split($name, ':') $bridge = $map[1] vs_bridge { $bridge: ensure => present, external_ids => "bridge-id=${bridge}" } }

subject: Actually test online flavor migrations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-30 16:56:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/db/test_flavor.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/641f5f4529509debef6e8e58f01a2ea20109c0be', 'message': "Actually test online flavor migrations

The way the test was written for online flavor migrations
we didn't have any flavors in the main database, so nothing
was migrated and nothing was asserting that we had migrated
anything. This is more or less due to using USES_DB_SELF
and then not populating the main database with any flavors.

This change creates a single flavor in the main database

Change-Id: Ia18f8abdf10785dc396f5c07e239326059528daf
Partial-Bug: #1653261

commit_message:
Actually test online flavor migrations

The way the test was written for online flavor migrations
we didn't have any flavors in the main database, so nothing
was migrated and nothing was asserting that we had migrated
anything. This is more or less due to using USES_DB_SELF
and then not populating the main database with any flavors.

This change creates a single flavor in the main database
prior to the online data migration and asserts we actually
started with one and it was migrated.

Change-Id: Ia18f8abdf10785dc396f5c07e239326059528daf
Partial-Bug: #1653261

commit_message:
Fix the usage of tempest.client.Manager class

This should fix our gate. We should continue the work to remove
the dependencies from any module that isn't at tempest.lib.

Change-Id: I2158d1971a4187171a89169c3f324453f0ec13be

deleted_lines: def __init__(self, credentials, service=None): super(Manager, self).__init__(credentials, service)

commit_message:
Update basic deployment commands for Newton

Update syntax for network and subnet commands to match the
latest changes in the openstackclient unified command line
client.

Change-Id: I53048b614bb293bdddbc9c888842c3a999737f36
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/71/387671/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: subnet list subnet set <subnet-uuid> --dns-nameserver <nameserver-ip> .. admonition:: Stable Branch For Mitaka release and older, the subnet commands are listed under the `neutron` command:: neutron subnet-list neutron subnet-update <subnet-uuid> --dns-nameserver <nameserver-ip> network create public --external --provider-network-type flat \ --provider-physical-network datacentre subnet create --allocation-pool start=172.16.23.140,end=172.16.23.240 \ --network public --gateway 172.16.23.251 --no-dhcp --subnet-range \ 172.16.23.128/25 public .. admonition:: Stable Branch For Liberty and earlier, the commands for creating networks are done via the `neutron` command:: neutron net-create public --router:external --provider:network_type flat \ --provider:physical_network datacentre neutron subnet-create --name public --disable-dhcp \ --allocation-pool start=172.16.23.140,end=172.16.23.240 \ --gateway 172.16.23.251 public 172.16.23.128/25 network list +--------------------------------------+----------+--------------------------------------+ | ID | Name | Subnets | +--------------------------------------+----------+--------------------------------------+ | 4db8dd5d-fab5-4ea9-83e5-bdedbf3e9ee6 | public | 7a315c5e-f8e2-495b-95e2-48af9442af01 | +--------------------------------------+----------+--------------------------------------+ network create public --external --provider-network-type vlan \ --provider-physical-network datacentre --provider-segment 195 \ subnet create --allocation-pool start=172.16.23.140,end=172.16.23.240 \ --network public --no-dhcp --gateway 172.16.23.251 \ --subnet-range 172.16.23.128/25 public

commit_message:
Revert "[CVE-2016-9599] Enforce Firewall TCP / UDP rules management"

Testing if this is what broke ipv6.  It should obviously not merge.

This reverts commit 70c9dca45335150daae65d0bbf44908711b0f1d2.

Change-Id: Iab9eae653737158aa524b67da392fc8cc97da428
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/95/416695/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $firewall_rules = { "100 ${name}_haproxy" => { 'dport' => $service_port, }, "100 ${name}_haproxy_ssl" => { 'dport' => $public_ssl_port, }, } create_resources('tripleo::firewall::rule', $firewall_rules)
deleted_lines: # This block will construct firewall rules only when we specify # a port for the regular service and also the ssl port for the service. # It makes sure we're not trying to create TCP iptables rules where no port # is specified. if $service_port { $haproxy_firewall_rules = { "100 ${name}_haproxy" => { 'dport' => $service_port, }, } } if $public_ssl_port { $haproxy_ssl_firewall_rules = { "100 ${name}_haproxy_ssl" => { 'dport' => $public_ssl_port, }, } } $firewall_rules = merge($haproxy_firewall_rules, $haproxy_ssl_firewall_rules) if $service_port or $public_ssl_port { create_resources('tripleo::firewall::rule', $firewall_rules) }

commit_message:
Add swift-recon example for Swift

Change-Id: I327ce182fe17cd77053751088186b73a870d38ed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/99/389999/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: You can also check this by using the ``swift-recon`` command on one of the overcloud nodes. It will query all other servers and compare all checksums and a summary like this:: [root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# swift-recon --md5 =============================================================================== --> Starting reconnaissance on 3 hosts (object) =============================================================================== [2016-10-14 12:37:11] Checking ring md5sums 3/3 hosts matched, 0 error[s] while checking hosts. =============================================================================== [2016-10-14 12:37:11] Checking swift.conf md5sum 3/3 hosts matched, 0 error[s] while checking hosts. ===============================================================================

subject: Raise exc when using multi-tenant and swift+config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-20 00:17:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance_store/commit/c7966e3fc9317cf25e1109af4d8543d4cff0032c', 'message': 'Raise exc when using multi-tenant and swift+config

When Swift multi-tenant store is used along with the
scheme ``swift+config``, a reference to use swift objects
is made resulting in the storage url for an accessible object
being created from a swift auth_address. This behavior is suitable
for single-tenant swift store and not multi-tenant store.

This patch solves this issue by ensuring that multi-tenant and
swift+config are not configured to work together.

TODO: When somebody changes to multi-tenant from single-tenant store,
and they were using swift+config for single-tenant, the operator will
not be able to access those images any longer. Logic to ensure that
multi-tenant uses the swift conf file if there is a need to  access
an image that was created using single-tenant and swift+config could be
introduced.

'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-18 21:17:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance_store/commit/d015c36e469c74f8a484b1272d8677420deddb1a', 'message': 'Raise exc when using multi-tenant and swift+config

When Swift multi-tenant store is used along with the
scheme ``swift+config`` (the scheme that identifies the
need to use the swift config), a reference to use swift
objects from the swift config file set using the option
``swift_store_config_file`` is made resulting in the
storage url for an accessible object being created from
a swift auth_address. So is the case when the scheme is
``swift``. This behavior is suitable for single-tenant
swift store and not multi-tenant store.

The solution is to ensure that if deploying multi-tenant swift
store, prohibit setting of swift_store_config_file.
This patch does this by ensuring that multi-tenant and
swift_store_config_file are not configured to work together.

TODO: When somebody changes to multi-tenant from single-tenant store,
and they were using the swift config for single-tenant, the operator will
not be able to access those images any longer. Logic to ensure that
multi-tenant uses the swift conf file if there is a need to  access
an image that was created using single-tenant and swift+config could be
introduced.

UpgradeImpact
DocImpact

Closes-Bug: 1625075

Change-Id: I8b5c31541d3c501ad7c2520b463f881599f4a28e

commit_message:
Raise exc when using multi-tenant and swift+config

When Swift multi-tenant store is used along with the
scheme ``swift+config`` (the scheme that identifies the
need to use the swift config), a reference to use swift
objects from the swift config file set using the option
``swift_store_config_file`` is made resulting in the
storage url for an accessible object being created from
a swift auth_address. So is the case when the scheme is
``swift``. This behavior is suitable for single-tenant
swift store and not multi-tenant store.

The solution is to ensure that if deploying multi-tenant swift
store, prohibit setting of swift_store_config_file.
This patch does this by ensuring that multi-tenant and
swift_store_config_file are not configured to work together.

TODO: When somebody changes to multi-tenant from single-tenant store,
and they were using the swift config for single-tenant, the operator will
not be able to access those images any longer. Logic to ensure that
multi-tenant uses the swift conf file if there is a need to  access
an image that was created using single-tenant and swift+config could be
introduced.

UpgradeImpact
DocImpact

Closes-Bug: 1625075

Change-Id: I8b5c31541d3c501ad7c2520b463f881599f4a28e
Co-Authored-By: Hemanth Makkapati <hemanth.makkapati@rackspace.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dharini Chandrasekar <dharini.chandrasekar@intel.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance_store refs/changes/44/388944/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_multi_tenant_with_swift_config(self): """ Test that Glance does not start when multi-tenant is configured with swift+config """ self.config(default_store='swift+config') self.config(swift_store_multi_tenant=True) self.assertRaises(exceptions.BadStoreConfiguration, Store, self.conf)

commit_message:
Add checks for keystone endpoints

Currently, endpoints for ironic and ironic-inspector creating each time
when install task is runned and causes duplication of endpoints.
This fix adds checks for endpoints existence.

Change-Id: I5bf1e7f1a1712cc324d219c5dbc0bbb22dee493f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/44/415444/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: "Check ironic-inspector admin endpoint exists" command: | openstack --os-identity-api-version 3 --os-username "{{ keystone.bootstrap.username }}" --os-password "{{ keystone.bootstrap.password }}" --os-auth-url "{{ ironic.service_catalog.auth_url | default('http://127.0.0.1:5000/') }}" --os-project-name admin endpoint list -f json --noindent --service baremetal-introspection --interface admin --region "{{ keystone.bootstrap.region_name | default('RegionOne') }}" no_log: true register: test_ironic_inspector_admin_endpoint - name: "Check ironic-inspector public endpoint exists" command: | openstack --os-identity-api-version 3 --os-username "{{ keystone.bootstrap.username }}" --os-password "{{ keystone.bootstrap.password }}" --os-auth-url "{{ ironic.service_catalog.auth_url | default('http://127.0.0.1:5000/') }}" --os-project-name admin endpoint list -f json --noindent --service baremetal-introspection --interface public --region "{{ keystone.bootstrap.region_name | default('RegionOne') }}" no_log: true register: test_ironic_inspector_public_endpoint - name: "Check ironic-inspector internal endpoint exists" command: | openstack --os-identity-api-version 3 --os-username "{{ keystone.bootstrap.username }}" --os-password "{{ keystone.bootstrap.password }}" --os-auth-url "{{ ironic.service_catalog.auth_url | default('http://127.0.0.1:5000/') }}" --os-project-name admin endpoint list -f json --noindent --service baremetal-introspection --interface internal --region "{{ keystone.bootstrap.region_name | default('RegionOne') }}" no_log: true register: test_ironic_inspector_internal_endpoint no_log: true when: test_ironic_inspector_admin_endpoint.rc != 0 or test_ironic_inspector_admin_endpoint.stdout == '[]' no_log: true when: test_ironic_inspector_public_endpoint.rc != 0 or test_ironic_inspector_public_endpoint.stdout == '[]' when: test_ironic_inspector_internal_endpoint.rc != 0 or test_ironic_inspector_internal_endpoint.stdout == '[]'

commit_message:
Add a dedicated Neutron networker role to sample NIC configs.

This change adds a networker role profile to each of the sample NIC
config template directories. The networker role is similar to the
controller role, but it doesn't have connections to the storage and
storage management networks. This should make it easier to test
dedicated neutron roles in CI at some point, and serves as an example
for creating cutom role configurations.

Change-Id: Ie768243227e303b7ee74b9031f124d6ab1712341
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/91/409391/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The networker role is for a dedicated Neutron networker node, which is similar to a controller, but doesn't require connectivity to the storage or storage management networks.

commit_message:
Add dhcp related tasks to inspection role

In case when inventory_dhcp is enabled and node is not deployed yet,
inspection is not working because dnsmasq ignores requests from unknown
address.

Change-Id: I048acc5093d186637db2e92915eb019dc3baab91

commit_message:
vs_config changes should restart controller

When a change is made with vs_config, the controller
should be restarted for the config changes to be
applied. Header documentation also updated to reflect
the value needed for ovn_remote parameter.

Change-Id: Id3d4997c3129977839eeaa7e74c7335f910baba3

commit_message:
Parameterizes caching mode for guest disk

Currently the cache mode for the guest is hardcoded to 'unsafe', which
is not suitable for any application where data loss is an issue.  This
patch allows a user to specify it, while keeping the default as unsafe
for backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: I3d4395ca09a95b2ecc122cf2922de613784d56f0
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Header documentation update for OVN

The header gives the impression that it is expecting
an array based on the sample values. This change
updates the documentation in the header to remove the
array braces to prevent confusion.

commit_message:
read data from stdout instead of stderr

As oslo.log upgrades to 3.17.0, the `use_stderr` now defaults to False.

commit_message:
Explicitly open port 443 for the TripleO UI

When SSL is enabled on the undercloud, the UI is served on port
443. Currently the port is opened thanks to another rule (for Horizon),
but let's be explicit about the UI requiring it so that it doesn't get
lost in the future.

Change-Id: Ia2b0628a84b4f1b8d90132d2134b7d7e3c80b211
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/46/416246/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: api-ref: add notes about POST/DELETE errors for os-tenant-networks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-29 21:47:31.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/os-tenant-network.inc'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f9bfb72a1c0c0aff48ce20fc60ec37a92361db4b', 'message': "api-ref: add notes about POST/DELETE errors for os-tenant-networks

After microversion 2.35 all of the os-tenant-networks methods will
return a 404 response. However, before that, if using neutron:

- POST will return a 503 error because the NotImplementedError is
  caught and translated to the 503.
- DELETE will return a 500 error because the NotImplementedError
  is NOT caught so results in a 500.

The API reference only noted that the API is deprecated since the
2.36 microversion but doesn't note that POST and DELETE are not
implemented, so this adds those details for unsuspecting victims.

Change-Id: I7f256a4c1a6e4247698fcb5ee7c56128c517e29b
Closes-Bug: #1652252
"}]
commit_message:
api-ref: add notes about POST/DELETE errors for os-tenant-networks

After microversion 2.35 all of the os-tenant-networks methods will
return a 404 response. However, before that, if using neutron:

- POST will return a 503 error because the NotImplementedError is
  caught and translated to the 503.
- DELETE will return a 500 error because the NotImplementedError
  is NOT caught so results in a 500.

The API reference only noted that the API is deprecated since the
2.36 microversion but doesn't note that POST and DELETE are not
implemented, so this adds those details for unsuspecting victims.

Change-Id: I7f256a4c1a6e4247698fcb5ee7c56128c517e29b
Closes-Bug: #1652252
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/60/415760/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note:: This API is only implemented for the nova-network service and will result in a 503 error response if the cloud is using the Neutron networking service. Use the Neutron ``networks`` API to create a new network. .. note:: This API is only implemented for the nova-network service and will result in a 500 error response if the cloud is using the Neutron networking service. Use the Neutron ``networks`` API to delete an existing network.

commit_message:
Bump senlinclient version to 1.1.0

Newer version of openstacksdk change its behavior on
resource update, which breaks senlinclient update
functions.

1.1.0 version of senlinclient fix those problems.

commit_message:
Xenserver - adding type and provider too manage rootwrap.conf

This simple patch is adding following stuff:

1. Adding minimize_polling parameter to ovs ml2 agent class.
2. Adding type and provider to mange rootwrap.conf file
mainly to manipulate XenServer connection parameters.

Change-Id: I3dad47a34af7bab7eefe46db39b3a5eedc7c3c7f
(cherry picked from commit f0101c709f29c18285a155230c62e7f15e736ea8)

commit_message:
Set access_policy for messaging's dispatcher

oslo.messaging allow dispatcher to restrict endpoint methods since
5.11.0 in d3a8f280ebd6fd12865fd20c4d772774e39aefa2, set with
DefaultRPCAccessPolicy to fix FutureWarning like:

"The access_policy argument is changing its default value to <class
'oslo_messaging.rpc.dispatcher.DefaultRPCAccessPolicy'> in version '?',
please update the code to explicitly set None as the value:
access_policy defaults to LegacyRPCAccessPolicy which exposes private
methods. Explicitly set access_policy to DefaultRPCAccessPolicy or
ExplicitRPCAccessPolicy.

Change-Id: I9a644624d4bfdf8830fe0012dc269da8a52559ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/94/416394/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_messaging.rpc import dispatcher access_policy = dispatcher.DefaultRPCAccessPolicy executor='eventlet', access_policy=access_policy)

commit_message:
Add enable_new_agents config option to neutron::server

Settings enable_new_agents to False will cause new neutron agents
that registers with the neutron-server to be disabled by default.

Change-Id: I9ed123799243bfb6d63ef34f2f75ca4b0cbd06ed
(cherry picked from commit badd275331bfeadba072bd2ca7c1252aec2a6c93)

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 13.3.12

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: I2722a364c84fb5d70022a6612bc76ea69dce2aa9

commit_message:
Add OSC Plugin for openstack appcontainer reboot

This change implements the "openstack appcontainer reboot" command
 Based on existing zun command: zun reboot

Partially Implements:blueprint zun-osc-plugin

Change-Id: I2969b1fe80b7184b7f10a16ea44de1feddd2eaf6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-zunclient refs/changes/65/416465/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class RebootContainer(command.Command): """Reboot specified container""" log = logging.getLogger(__name__ + ".Rebootcontainer") def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(RebootContainer, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'container', nargs='+', help='ID or name of the (container)s to reboot.') return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): client = _get_client(self, parsed_args) containers = parsed_args.container for container in containers: try: client.containers.reboot(container) print(_('Request to reboot container %s has been accepted') % container) except Exception as e: print("Reboot for container %(container)s failed: %(e)s" % {'container': container, 'e': e})

commit_message:
correct waiting for instance

Correct the waiting for instance states in the face of the fact that
we are doing this with polling on an underlying infrastructure of
unpredictable speed.

commit_message:
Notify Clients on OSD Creation

The MDS client has a race condition where if the osds don't
come up fast enough the rpc requests sent to ceph_broker
will never complete.

Change-Id: I3f78a5a3231377f5542b81cec27dd4531144cfd1

subject: Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-23 15:16:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova/commit/baa2123c099d30d8a89b451dbd837de48ad805ab', 'message': 'Expand db sync timeouts

As Openstack projects continue to push modifications
to their database schemas, the number of migration files
invoked by a database sync against a clean database continues
to grow.  While projects have the option to flatten their earliest
migrations into a single "build-at-once" script, so far this
does not seem to be happening, and it should be expected that
the time spent during "db sync" will begin to surpass the
Puppet default of 300 seconds for an "exec" within a wider
range of environments.   Currently, I'm not able to get tripleo
to finish a three-controller pacemaker overcloud install on an "all-in-one"
(e.g. Galera running on VMs) environment without both Nova and Neutron
db sync timing out, and others have had the same problem as well,
so we're already beginning to need more than 300 seconds for the
most database-intensive projects on modestly underpowered
environments.  This trend will continue to occur more frequently
as the length of migrations grows.

The patch here floats two proposals that would be replicated
across all the database related puppet-* projects.  One is to
double the timeout from Puppet's 300 second default to 600, and the other
is to make the default value configurable via a Hiera variable.
If Tripleo developers approve of either or both of these, I
can make up a new launchpad issue and patches for all the DB
related projects.

Change-Id: I6b30a4d9e3ca25d9a473e4eb614a8769fa4567e7
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-03 16:55:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova/commit/36cfa26b81de96cbc4f204403af74224c3304093', 'message': 'Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

As Openstack projects continue to have longer database migration
chains, the Puppet default timeout of 300 seconds for an execution
is becoming too short a duration on some hardware, leading to timeouts.
As projects continue to add more migration scripts without "pruning"
the base, timeouts will continue to become more frequent unless
this time can be expanded.

The proposed change adds a configuration option db_sync_timeout
which maintains the Puppet default of 300 but allows TripleO to
change the timeout to something higher.

Change-Id: I6b30a4d9e3ca25d9a473e4eb614a8769fa4567e7
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-04 16:58:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova/commit/352e74650c8e926fb168fbd200b8143aa82e7c77', 'message': 'Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

The proposed change adds a configuration option db_sync_timeout

Change-Id: I6b30a4d9e3ca25d9a473e4eb614a8769fa4567e7
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-04 18:13:20.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/db/sync.pp', 'manifests/db/sync_api.pp', 'releasenotes/notes/add_db_sync_timeout-88f19f3a5c9f8a42.yaml', 'spec/classes/nova_db_sync_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/nova_db_sync_api_spec.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova/commit/59858c08677d8a633bbb1cbaf4b0dc5504595d5f', 'message': 'Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

commit_message:
Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

As Openstack projects continue to have longer database migration
chains, the Puppet default timeout of 300 seconds for an execution
is becoming too short a duration on some hardware, leading to timeouts.
As projects continue to add more migration scripts without "pruning"
the base, timeouts will continue to become more frequent unless
this time can be expanded.

The proposed change adds a configuration option db_sync_timeout
which maintains the Puppet default of 300 but allows TripleO to
change the timeout to something higher.

Change-Id: I6b30a4d9e3ca25d9a473e4eb614a8769fa4567e7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/13/414613/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*db_sync_timeout*] # (optional) Timeout for the execution of the db_sync # Defaults to hiera('db_sync_timeout', 600), # $db_sync_timeout = hiera('db_sync_timeout', 600), timeout => $db_sync_timeout,

commit_message:
Fix multirack routes installation for vrouter and haproxy

1. Both scripts do not flush ip route table for non-local
   routes, which makes them non-idempotent
2. Haproxy did not add routes on reload

Change-Id: I498870b45ac47e6d6d8808d18964f3c2777c930c
Closes-bug: #1652765
(cherry picked from commit a4ad4193684a133beb80aec977e0f910ce2fcab6)

commit_message:
Adds diskimage-create scripts to pypi package

This patch adds the diskimage-create script and associated files
to the pypi package under share/octavia so that operators have the
required script to be able to build amphora images.
This also includes the README and LICENSE file for octavia.

Change-Id: Id014c4ac067de223f15a6bc2382aa2529cf89a13
Closes-Bug: #1654099

commit_message:
Revert "Move containers tripleo job from experimental"

This job is not passing (it's literally stubbed out as an
"exit 1" in the tripleo-ci scripts).  It should not have been
moved from experimental.

This reverts commit 8baf0b0d1e0515e1c90c5609b4d875a0d38c7238.

commit_message:
[Docs] Clarify Tags rules

We had an ansible style guide, but we didn't speak about how to
use tags.

This should clarify tag usage.

Change-Id: Ie34d70a85abf81744ffee34a6318c5f336531694
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/91/416991/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: YAML formatting --------------- Tags and tags conventions ------------------------- Give tags based on item relevance: higher level includes (for example in the ``tasks/main.yml``) need high level tags like *-config or *-install, where included tasks could have more detailed tags. The following convention is used: * A tag including the word "install" handles software installation tasks. Running a playbook with ``--tags <role>-install`` will only deploy the necessary software on the target, and will not configure it to your needs or run any service. * A tag including the word "config" prepares the configuration of the software (adapted to your needs), and all the components necessary to run the service(s) configured in the role. Running a playbook with ``--tags <role>-config`` is only possible if the target already ran the tags ``<role>-install``. * A tag including the word "upgrade" is handling all the upgrade tasks.

commit_message:
Set DIB_DEBIAN_COMPONENTS: 'main,universe' for ubuntu-minimal

By default the ubuntu-minimal element also include restricted. Because
we don't use restricted in our AFS mirrors we can drop this at
diskimage build time.

Change-Id: I64248182bab7ec46bbdfcb01b097133a6aa28a5b
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

Service Function Chain (SFC) For a given service, SFC is the abstracted view of the required service functions and the order in which they are to be applied. Software-defined networking (SDN) Provides an approach for network administrators to manage computer network services through abstraction of lower-level functionality.

added_lines: Network Service Header (NSH) Provides a mechanism for metadata exchange along the instantiated service path. policy-based routing (PBR) Provides a mechanism to implement packet forwarding and routing according to the policies defined by the network administrator. Service Function Chain (SFC) For a given service, SFC is the abstracted view of the required service functions and the order in which they are to be applied. Software-defined networking (SDN) Provides an approach for network administrators to manage computer network services through abstraction of lower-level functionality.

commit_message:
Blacklist rather than whitelist autodoc modules

Autogenerate the nova client python API module list rather than having
to remember to add new modules; use exclude to blacklist modules that
shouldn't be included in autodoc.

Change-Id: I051a7094f3b536f1e9a939af87e3fc89554fb375
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/56/415756/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_module_names(): names = os.listdir(os.path.join(ROOT, 'novaclient', 'v2')) exclude = ['shell.py', '__init__.py'] for name in names: if name.endswith('.py') and name not in exclude: yield name.strip('.py') gen_ref("v2", "Version 1.1, Version 2 API", get_module_names())

commit_message:
nova: activate placement API service

Activate a new service in Nova: Placement API
It will be mandatory in the future.
docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/placement.html
Note: testing only on Centos7. Ubuntu package is broken.

Change-Id: I02f5ec6b99f14ec3568934815c45efb83711d706

commit_message:
Trivial fix LOG.exception issues

Remove redundant 'error' parameter in LOG.exception,
and replace some LOG.error with LOG.exception.

Change-Id: I46c14014c9dc38da9ea3b8ae98c9bd2aafe478d7

deleted_lines: from manila.i18n import _, _LI, _LW, _LE except Exception as e: msg = (_('Unexpected exception calling startfsnapclean for FPG ' '%(fpg)s: %(e)s') % {'fpg': fpg, 'e': six.text_type(e)}) LOG.exception(msg) except Exception as e: LOG.exception(e) except Exception as e: LOG.exception(e) except Exception as e: LOG.exception(e)

commit_message:
Adding Kerb definition to External auth methods

Added definition of kerberos to external auth methods section.
Updated list type to better fit term and definition format.

Change-Id: Ib655b0010ccfaa814b312d44097203f4dd06c582
Closes-Bug: 1411510
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/security-doc refs/changes/38/416138/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Password policy enforcement Requires user passwords to conform to minimum standards for length, diversity of characters, expiration, or failed login attempts. In an external authentication scenario this would be the password policy on the original identity store. Multi-factor authentication The authentication service requires the user to provide information based on something they have, such as a one-time password token or X.509 certificate, and something they know, such as a password. Kerberos A mutual authentication network protocol using 'tickets' to secure communication between client and server. The Kerberos ticket-granting ticket can be used to securely provide tickets for a given service.
deleted_lines: - Password policy enforcement: Requires user passwords to conform to minimum standards for length, diversity of characters, expiration, or failed login attempts. - Multi-factor authentication: The authentication service requires the user to provide information based on something they have, such as a one-time password token or X.509 certificate, and something they know, such as a password. - Kerberos

commit_message:
Remove the reseller config of Tempest

For following to Keystone development, the default value of Tempest
is changed to enabled on this config option.
So it is not necessary to specify it on Devstack side.

Change-Id: I6774f4ed6b6136fefc52f48194f58a3a7dfe6264
Depends-On: Id3dd322b3a0585ed95eb2dea4ad35a7949bb9b1f

subject: Use the installed swift scripts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-05 00:56:07.000000000', 'files': ['lib/swift'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/85879f1f8157a60fc190eb2731e4edd0deb1dae3', 'message': "Use the installed swift scripts

This commit switches how scripts we use to launch the installed version
in the path. Previously the scripts were manually executed in the source
repo, but this has issues if you're trying to run with py3 in a system
where python == py2. Setuptools already does the shebang magic for us
at install time, so we just need to use the installed version of the
script.

Change-Id: Iaa4d80ec607a2aa200400330e16cad3a4ca782ac
"}]
commit_message:
Use the installed swift scripts

This commit switches how scripts we use to launch the installed version
in the path. Previously the scripts were manually executed in the source
repo, but this has issues if you're trying to run with py3 in a system
where python == py2. Setuptools already does the shebang magic for us
at install time, so we just need to use the installed version of the
script.

Change-Id: Iaa4d80ec607a2aa200400330e16cad3a4ca782ac

commit_message:
Adds publish option for multi version api

Adds test for generating reference with nested
indexes/multiple versions of api.

Checks for title prefix and removes prefix from
method description/title, permitting duplicate
method labels in tree. Removes prefix from toc.

Closes-Bug: #1583623.

Change-Id: I5105388c865caaf8e3830c6b7dbaee062949f76d

commit_message:
Add virt driver 'zun' to devstack

According to the feedback in the TC meeting [1], we renamed the Nova
virt driver from "docker" to "zun" [2] to avoid name collision
to nova-docker. This rename also help to clarify the difference
between these two drivers.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/tc/2016/
    tc.2016-11-29-20.01.log.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/414651/

Change-Id: I747080953ae4d1d35ed334831100413b6e4466c4

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-05 16:57:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/6e0e4c9a97d1f9a8ca33854fb1bd16c23846d084', 'message': "Make the grenade.*forward.* jobs be non-voting for stable

In commit 8046d71803c1375fd4689e8afb81647374106f8a it changed the
grenade-dsvm-forward-ubuntu-trusty and
grenade-dsvm-forward-ubuntu-xenial jobs to be voting for some stable
branches.

This is breaking some jobs, for example the stable/newton branch of
openstack-dev/devstack.

"}]
commit_message:
Correct the grenade.*forward.* jobs regex

Fixed the regular expression to match the grenade.*forward jobs, as it
wouldn't have actually matched the job.

Change-Id: Iec22446601ca38d2d4d0b710ef0e266acf7b7ef7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/93/417093/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: ^.*grenade-dsvm(-.*)?-forward-ubuntu-trusty$ branch: ^stable/.*$ - name: ^.*grenade-dsvm(-.*)?-forward-ubuntu-xenial$ branch: ^stable/.*$

added_lines: Network Service Header (NSH) Provides a mechanism for metadata exchange along the instantiated service path. policy-based routing (PBR) A technique used to make routing decisions based on policies set by the network administrator in computer networking. Service Function Chain (SFC) For a given service, the abstracted view of the required service functions and the order in which they are to be applied. Software-defined networking (SDN) An approach to computer networking that allows network administrators to manage network services through abstraction of lower-level functionality.

commit_message:
Fix beaker under centos

beaker-puppet_install_helper 0.6.0 has made the PUPPET_INSTALL_TYPE now
default to agent which was the previous behavior we had when running
under puppet 4. Since puppet 3 is now officially EOL, this switches the
defaut to assume puppet agent packaging rather than the foss version.

Change-Id: I3243f9d7bdb19840f6462c5b6b237c2314a71fbe
(cherry picked from commit 6d5803d05a6e308e3c315c2689f1cec031d21fad)

commit_message:
run trusty on mitaka for aodh

mitaka devstack doesn't work with xenial -- it must run on trusty.
this patch runs functional and tempest gates on trusty for
mitaka and run them on xenial if otherwise

Change-Id: Ie89973df313532346134bd3af12f57a7438727fc

commit_message:
Revert "Remove an unused variable in the BaseTestCase class"

This reverts commit e4be907e34e043888bb10b29655018dd2d4eb06e.

The commit broke the keystone gate, our functional tests now fail.
Opening the revert as a first pass. We'll see if we can fix things on
our side.

Change-Id: I3f4daec1ba10c50cb1da4ecd1e27d4de48e126ad

commit_message:
Trivial fix: correct names of capitalization styles

The guideline on how to capitalize complex names uses the corresponding
style when mentioning the different styles to illustrate what each style
looks like. But the entry for 'MixedCase' is wrong. First, it is written
in CamelCase, but more importantly, "mixed case" refers to a variety of
styles of capitalization [0]. The only mixed case besides camelCase for
joined words is commonly called 'StUdLyCaPs' [1], in which the
capitalization is randomly altered.

[0] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capitalization
[1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Studly_caps

Change-Id: I41691bed53d5e30b445d042efbf6a7b5dce43185

commit_message:
Fix placement service for identity-v3

The domain_name to be used needs to be $SERVICE_DOMAIN_NAME, as this is
changed in devstack from "Default" to "service".

Change-Id: I6351c1b2ca7ea4448e13eb87455bff4058df4fa7

commit_message:
[Docs] Add a todo list of the regular contributions

Each cycle, we have to do a series of task for OpenStack-Ansible.
In order to not forget them, we should list them, with their
expected timeframe for a cycle.

This should bootstrap the listing initiative.

Change-Id: I2d9525c1fc054c857fd935a201ad7eab2c84915c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/23/416923/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Development cycle checklist ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ On top of the cycle goals, a contributor can help the OpenStack-Ansible developments by helping on our recurring tasks. During the development cycle, the OpenStack-Ansible community has to: * [Milestone 2] Handle deprecations from upstream projects' previous cycle * [Milestone 2] Handle OpenStack-Ansible roles deprecations from the previous cycle * [Milestone 2] Refresh static elements in roles (update a specific version of the software like a version of rabbitmq/percona/... packages)

commit_message:
Remove creation of pki cache directories

The PKI/PKIZ token formats have been removed from keystone. As a
result, there is no need to create the cache directories for the
key files. This patch removes the changes from grenade while
another I3155ee7ae5db9eb899e9016e7f1270e92ba369ea, removes it from
devstack.

Change-Id: Iaaad0aeb61d77fedab329b004566501d0d1065dd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/15/392415/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Any change to the state machine is also a REST API change, and should also be documented accordingly in the next section.* Discuss any policy changes, and discuss what things a deployer needs to think about when defining their policy. Note that the schema should be defined as restrictively as possible. Parameters which are required should be marked as such and only under exceptional circumstances should additional parameters which are not defined in the schema be permitted. Use of free-form JSON dicts should only be permitted where necessary to allow divergence in the drivers. In such case, the drivers must expose the expected content of the JSON dict and an ability to validate it. Reuse of existing predefined parameter types is highly encouraged. functionality and deploys the same disk partition as it is without setting

commit_message:
Update rescue spec

Update rescue process and states to more accurately reflect intended
design.

Change-Id: Ice1e545b57fe1c3b3fc99514a05c3c1a82b7b003
Partial-bug: 1526449
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/36/407236/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: RPC call (ACTIVE -> RESCUING).7. Driver boots rescue ramdisk (RESCUING -> RESCUEWAIT), using the configured boot driver. As part of this process, Ironic will put the node onto the rescue_network, as configured in ironic.conf. 8. Agent ramdisk boots, performs a lookup (/v1/lookup in ironic-api), gets node info back, and begins heartbeating (/v1/heartbeat in ironic-api). 9. Upon receiving heartbeat, the conductor calls prepare_rescue (/v1/commands) with config drive and rescue password. 10. Agent extracts network info from config drive and sets aside along with rescue password. 11. After next heartbeat, conductor polls IPA (/v1/commands) for SUCCESS or FAILURE. 12. On command success, the conductor calls finalize_rescue (/v1/commands) (RESCUEWAIT -> RESCUING). If using multiple networks, the conductor flips network ports putting the node back on the tenant network (RESCUING -> RESCUE). 13. Agent sets password, configures network, and stops agent service. * RESCUEWAIT -> RESCUING (callback succeeds) * RESCUEWAIT -> DELETING (delete without waiting)
deleted_lines: RPC call.7. Driver boots rescue ramdisk, using the configured boot driver. As part of this process, Ironic will put the node onto the rescue_network, as configured in ironic.conf. 8. IPA ramdisk boots, performs a lookup and sets rescue password based on returned data and begins heartbeating. 9. Upon receiving heartbeat the conductor, if using multiple networks, places the instance back onto the tenant network, isolating the rescue ramdisk from the ironic control plane. When this completes, the node's provision state will change to RESCUE. 10. Inside the rescue image, automation (such as cloud-init), should configure the rescue image as appropriate. * RESCUEWAIT -> RESCUE (finish rescue after callback) * RESCUE -> UNRESCUEFAIL (unrescue fails)

commit_message:
Add warning message when --heat-url is ignored

--heat-url is ignored when it is passed without --os-no-client-auth.

Change-Id: Ic838b0c8b92674d4b49c84bc4593a7ef0810b987
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/24/417024/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if args.heat_url and not args.os_no_client_auth: logger.warning('--os-no-client-auth not passed, ignoring ' '--heat-url option')

commit_message:
Adds a profile for the Ceph MDS service

This change adds a profile to deploy the Ceph MDS service and some
basic unit tests for it.

Depends-On: I558b43deaa9b243c54f3d7ae945f11dd4925eb5d
Change-Id: Iaecc3ff7acb851776c5057c42a5a513a70425d2c
Partial-Bug: #1644784

commit_message:
Fix expecting content-type headers

It does not contain the charset anymore, for an unknown reason. It's not a
big deal though, so just fix it.

Change-Id: I0583a8cedfecb9353d23978269f8a6f1fee171a4
(cherry picked from commit dc681f4c1303c2dfc1b32efc00dfeafb66dcbaf4)

We're trying to debug a critical problem in Neutron that cause TripleO
HA deployments failing on pinging a floating-IP. This bug probably
affects all HA deployments in OpenStack.

To help in debug, add the ovb-ha job in experimental pipeline, so
Neutron developers can fix the problem and make sure it works in
tripleo.

Change-Id: I3a47092357c79486d33d9c155dd50f5febbb98fa
"}]
commit_message:
neutron: add tripleo-ovb-ha in experimental

We're trying to debug a critical problem in Neutron that cause TripleO
HA deployments failing on pinging a floating-IP. This bug probably
affects all HA deployments in OpenStack.

To help in debug, add the ovb-ha job in experimental pipeline, so
Neutron developers can fix the problem and make sure it works in
tripleo.

Change-Id: I3a47092357c79486d33d9c155dd50f5febbb98fa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/73/416973/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: experimental-tripleo: - gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-ha

All workflows not using the undercloud ready image
are required to setup the undercloud so that it

this role abstracts out the common setup pieces to be
included in playbooks for these workflows.

commit_message:
Add generic undercloud setup role

All workflows not using the undercloud ready image
are required to setup the undercloud so that it
contains the elements required for installation and
deploy.

This role should include general undercloud set up
steps but can also include environment specific
steps that are only run under certain conditions.

Steps to get and modify overcloud images are in a
separate role - to be extracted from tripleo-quickstart.
Steps to get and enable repos are in a separate role.

Change-Id: Ibc5af913378ee6b713f94a775ea8ba8b6ffbfd0c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/24/406324/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- - name: Create undercloud access key delegate_to: "{{ localhost }}" command: > ssh-keygen -f {{ undercloud_key }} -N '' -C 'ansible_generated_virt_host' -t rsa -b 4096 args: creates: "{{ undercloud_key }}" - name: Create non-root user on undercloud user: name: "{{ non_root_user }}" state: present shell: /bin/bash become: true - name: Configure non-root user authorized_keys on undercloud authorized_key: user: "{{ non_root_user }}" key: "{{ item }}" with_file: - "{{ undercloud_key }}.pub" become: true - name: Grant sudo privileges to non-root user on undercloud copy: content: | {{ non_root_user }} ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL dest: /etc/sudoers.d/{{ non_root_user }} owner: root group: root mode: 0440 become: true

subject: DO NOT MERGE: Display token request log
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-05 14:45:10.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/lib/services/identity/v2/token_client.py', 'tempest/lib/services/identity/v3/token_client.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/d32ebce421e548713a324e4918e2717e7b55a0b5', 'message': 'DO NOT MERGE: Display token request log

Keystone tests are failing because it is getting an unscoped token
instead of a scoped one, this is a test patch to display the content of
the request so we find the reason behind receiving the unscoped token.

Change-Id: I6e8e04b5339eb033fb29c3ff3689be561ce4ca32
'}]
commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: Display token request log

Keystone tests are failing because it is getting an unscoped token
instead of a scoped one, this is a test patch to display the content of
the request so we find the reason behind receiving the unscoped token.

Change-Id: I6e8e04b5339eb033fb29c3ff3689be561ce4ca32
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/90/416990/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: req_body=body, resp_body=resp_body)

subject: Support filtering resource providers by aggregate membership
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-06 18:04:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/bc8444546cc26a61a3206d3a9a31d2075c9a32ba', 'message': "Support filtering resource providers by aggregates

This provides the backend for allowing an HTTP query of
'/resource_providers?aggregate=in:$uuid_1,$uuid_2,$uuid_3'
which will return those resource providers which are members of any

commit_message:
Support filtering resource providers by aggregate membership

This provides the backend for allowing an HTTP query of
'/resource_providers?member_of=in:$uuid_1,$uuid_2,$uuid_3'
which will return those resource providers which are members of any
of the listed aggregates.

This is done by extending the ResourceProvider.get_all_by_filters
methods to accept an additional 'member_of' filter with a value
of a list of aggregate uuids.

Change-Id: I1a69f7426b23f7b118bac7877b64700e688e8c6d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/29/407629/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_get_all_by_filters_aggregate(self): for rp_i in [1, 2, 3, 4]: uuid = getattr(uuidsentinel, 'rp_uuid_' + str(rp_i)) name = 'rp_name_' + str(rp_i) rp = objects.ResourceProvider(self.context, name=name, uuid=uuid) rp.create() if rp_i % 2: aggregate_uuids = [uuidsentinel.agg_a, uuidsentinel.agg_b] rp.set_aggregates(aggregate_uuids) resource_providers = objects.ResourceProviderList.get_all_by_filters( self.context, filters={'aggregate': [uuidsentinel.agg_a]}) self.assertEqual(2, len(resource_providers)) names = [_rp.name for _rp in resource_providers] self.assertIn('rp_name_1', names) self.assertIn('rp_name_3', names) self.assertNotIn('rp_name_2', names) self.assertNotIn('rp_name_4', names) resource_providers = objects.ResourceProviderList.get_all_by_filters( self.context, filters={'aggregate': [uuidsentinel.agg_a, uuidsentinel.agg_b]}) self.assertEqual(2, len(resource_providers)) resource_providers = objects.ResourceProviderList.get_all_by_filters( self.context, filters={'aggregate': [uuidsentinel.agg_a, uuidsentinel.agg_b], 'name': u'rp_name_1'}) self.assertEqual(1, len(resource_providers)) resource_providers = objects.ResourceProviderList.get_all_by_filters( self.context, filters={'aggregate': [uuidsentinel.agg_a, uuidsentinel.agg_b], 'name': u'barnabas'}) self.assertEqual(0, len(resource_providers)) resource_providers = objects.ResourceProviderList.get_all_by_filters( self.context, filters={'aggregate': [uuidsentinel.agg_1, uuidsentinel.agg_2]}) self.assertEqual(0, len(resource_providers))

commit_message:
Improve overcloud nodes debuggability

This patch intends to improve the deployment debuggability of the
overcloud nodes by:

* Enables debug log level in Ironic-Python-Agent ramdisk by passing
  ipa-debug=1 in the kernel command line.

* Redirects the console of the booting VMs to
  /var/log/overcloud_vms/<name>.log

Change-Id: Ib751169a2cfe26ace6c148d77c46d1441655a8b9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/81/403781/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[AMQP 1.0] Propagate authentication errors to caller

When the connection fails due to an authentication issue raise a
MessageDeliveryFailure on all pending send requests. Include the
authentication error message in the exception.

Change-Id: I06b40c6c480a4d082dce64801736b3d12f696c26
Closes-Bug: 1508512

commit_message:
Replaces uuid.uuid4 with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids. We should
use that function when generating uuids for consistency.

Change-Id: I50cd018b490dea341e6bcfb3034a0244194b4d99
Closes-Bug: #1082248
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.middleware refs/changes/43/407843/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import uuidutils uuidutils.generate_uuid())

2. Haproxy did not add routes on reload

Change-Id: I498870b45ac47e6d6d8808d18964f3c2777c930c
Closes-bug: #1652765
'}]
commit_message:
Fix multirack routes installation for vrouter and haproxy

1. Both scripts do not flush ip route table for non-local
   routes, which makes them non-idempotent
2. Haproxy did not add routes on reload

Change-Id: I498870b45ac47e6d6d8808d18964f3c2777c930c
Closes-bug: #1652765

commit_message:
Extend Senlin to support mistral workflow service

This patch includes spec about extending Senlin with mistral support.

Change-Id: I17c42f67823313a0531c24647f319b263e760a0c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/79/414979/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Support Workflow Service as Recover Action ========================================== Nowdays, Senlin supports many different actions for the purpose of cluster management. Espesially for auto-healing use case, Senlin provides check and recover to support customisable loop by health policy. Where three kinds of detection types can be chosen: NODE_STATUS_POLLING, LB_STATUS_POLLING, VM_LIFECYCLE_EVENTS. Once any failure is detected of the given type, recover action can be executed automatically or manually. Also in the health policy, users can define list of actions under recovery category, which can be retried on a failed node. Some simple recover actions can be embed into the Senlin like rebuild, or recreate. But some complex actions are a chain of simple actions. For an example, evacuate needs to verfiy if the targeted node can be evacuable, then execute the action, and confimration is often needed to check if the action is succeed or not. To support these cases, this spec targets to make Senlin cooperable with mistral workflow service and allows to use user-defined workflow as the recover actions. Problem description =================== This spec is to extend senlin to support mistral workflow for more complex and customisable recover actions. Use Cases --------- One typical use case is to allow users to induce their own or existed mistral workflow for recover purpose. Proposed change =============== The proposed change will include three parts: * driver: to add mistral support into Senlin * profile: to add workflow support as one of do_recover implements * example: to add examplified workflow definitions for Senlin users to create a end2end story. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None in the first version Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- If there is mistral installed inside the same environment and the users wanna leverage the worjflow functions, this spec provides support to cooperate Senlin and mistral for the auto-healing purpose. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- lxinhui@vmware.com Work Items ---------- The primary work items in Senlin will focus on adding a new driver for mistral and implements of do_recover in profile. Dependencies ============ * Mistral: need to migrate the current APIs into the versioned. * Openstacksdk: need to support workflow service. Testing ======= Unit tests will be provided. End2End test will be provided as examples for Senlin users. Documentation Impact ==================== There will be new section to add about guidance about how to use defined workflows as recover action. References ========== [1] Mistral patch about API migration: https://review.openstack.org/414755 [2] Openstacksdk patch about support of mistral service https://review.openstack.org/414919 History ======= None .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Ocata - Introduced

commit_message:
Revert "Ignore heartbeats lock fails"

It seems that there are at least two level of ruby-stomp brokenness and
the fact that the mutex in original commit is locked actually means
there is no heartbeat received in time and we need to do something about
this.

This reverts commit 8318d7056556337f17f596edad9d7eed48ec3ca5.

Partial-Bug: #1644618
Change-Id: I565f430d17bcee2c50c0ddc8ecc11f3dc8b420ed

commit_message:
Update and clean up run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script fails when it is run multiple times on CentOS.
The `bindep` run returns an empty list of packages and then `yum`
exits with an error since no packages were provided to install.

This patch checks the length of the `bindep` output and skips the `yum`
installation when the package list is empty.

The patch also cleans up some of the old cruft left over from previous
scripts and avoids repetition.

Change-Id: Ibe4d0fd9d608dc725c354723143e60c89cd99b4b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/62/416662/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if apt-get -v >/dev/null 2>&1; then YUM_PKGS=$(bindep -b -f bindep.txt) # Don't run yum with an empty list of packages. It will fail and # cause the script to exit with an error. if [[ ${#YUM_PKGS} > 0 ]]; then sudo yum install -y `bindep -b -f bindep.txt test` fi
deleted_lines: if apt-get -v >/dev/null 2>&1 ; then sudo yum install -y `bindep -b -f bindep.txt test`

nova-api: switch to new wsgi class

nova::wsgi::apache was deprecated in ocata in favor of
nova::wsgi::apache_api.
Let's switch to it.

commit_message:
Remove support for legacy VNFD templates.

From Mitaka version, Tacker supports TOSCA based VNFD templates. Legacy
templates described under tacker/samples/legacy-templates are deprecated
in newton. Removing in Ocata.

Implements: blueprint deprecate-legacy-template-dsl
Closes-Bug: #1632214
Change-Id: I39f200bb536f4c5d10c920fc1c93bf8f382ca6c2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker refs/changes/86/382786/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: template_name: cirros_user_data description: Parameterized VNF descriptor that supports passing values for 'user_data' and 'user_data_format' during VNF deploy using the format show in vnf_cirros_param_values_user_data.yaml file service_properties: Id: cirros vendor: ACME version: 1 type: - router - firewall vdus: vdu1: id: vdu1 vm_image: { get_input: vm_image } instance_type: {get_input: flavor } service_type: {get_input: service} mgmt_driver: noop user_data: {get_input: user_data} user_data_format: {get_input: user_data_format} network_interfaces: management: network: { get_input: network } management: { get_input: management } pkt_in: network: { get_input: pkt_in_network } pkt_out: network: { get_input: pkt_out_network } placement_policy: availability_zone: { get_input: zone } auto-scaling: noop monitoring_policy: noop failure_policy: noop config: param0: key0 param1: key1

commit_message:
Adds missing OpenDaylight username/password from ODL OVS service

ODL username and password are already present in the OpenDaylightApi
service.  However, when moving the OpenDaylightApi service to its own
custom role, the Controller/Compute nodes no longer have access to these
hiera values.  This patch adds them also to the OpenDaylightOvs service.

Closes-Bug: 1651499
Depends-On: I418643810ee6b8a2c17a4754c83453140ebe39c7

Change-Id: I169fdad4c94bd6dfc1fe7cde3d6b19b36d916af7
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/05/413205/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OpenDaylightUsername: default: 'admin' description: The username for the opendaylight server. type: string OpenDaylightPassword: default: 'admin' type: string description: The password for the opendaylight server. hidden: true opendaylight::username: {get_param: OpenDaylightUsername} opendaylight::password: {get_param: OpenDaylightPassword}

commit_message:
Add default searchPath to almost all templates.

This ps adds a searchPath to almost all of the templates to make it
easier to start using kolla_val_get.*

Change-Id: I7d5108cba9862c094c91d7a2b30b81e7bf18b2d3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/29/416729/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {{- $searchPath := ":global.kolla.neutron.create_keystone_service.job:global.kolla.neutron.create_keystone_service.all:global.kolla.neutron.all:global.kolla.all" }}{{- with $env := dict "netHostTrue" $netHostTrue "podTypeBootstrap" $podTypeBootstrap "resourceName" $resourceName "serviceName" $serviceName "serviceType" $serviceType "description" $description "Values" .Values "Release" .Release "searchPath" $searchPath }}

subject: Decouples neutron services from OpenDaylight API service
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-20 18:44:45.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/neutron/opendaylight.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/1adc49a38985a884ca66643bc528e1c3298a75e1', 'message': 'Decouples neutron services from OpenDaylight API service

Removes including Neutron services in the OpenDaylight API service.
This was breaking custom roles when splitting up OpenDaylight and Neutron
into different roles.  Also, references to "controller" are removed
because with custom roles OpenDaylight could be isolated to any role
type.  The 'bootstrap_nodeid' still works with any role, and only
resolves to the first node in the series of nodes for that role type.

Partial-Bug: 1651499

Change-Id: I418643810ee6b8a2c17a4754c83453140ebe39c7
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Decouples neutron services from OpenDaylight API service

Removes including Neutron services in the OpenDaylight API service.
This was breaking custom roles when splitting up OpenDaylight and Neutron
into different roles.  Also, references to "controller" are removed
because with custom roles OpenDaylight could be isolated to any role
type.  The 'bootstrap_nodeid' still works with any role, and only
resolves to the first node in the series of nodes for that role type.

Partial-Bug: 1651499

Change-Id: I418643810ee6b8a2c17a4754c83453140ebe39c7
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/04/413204/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
